Description:
Awoo.space is a Mastodon instance where members can rely on a team of moderators to help resolve conflict, and limits federation with other instances using a specific access list to minimize abuse. It isn't aimed at any specific audience, though there are a lot of queer furries here for some reason üòÑ

While mature content is allowed here, we strongly believe in being able to choose to engage with content on your own terms, so please make sure to put mature and potentially sensitive content behind the content warning (CW) feature with enough description that people know what it's about.

Before signing up, please read our community guidelines. While it's a very broad swath of topics it covers, please do your best! We believe that as long as you're putting forth genuine effort to limit harm you might cause ‚Äì even if you haven't read the document ‚Äì you'll be okay!

Favicon, about page and menu column art by @kyra (@heres_ky on Twitter)

This server uses Mutant Standard emoji made by Dzuk (plus some more that aren't part of Mutant Standard, including controller emoji and hbomb DK64 fan emoji), which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Blobhaj emojos by Heatherhorns are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
Short:
Awoo.space is a Mastodon instance where members can rely on a team of moderators to help resolve conflict, and limits federation with other instances using a specific access list to minimize abuse.

While mature content is allowed here, we strongly believe in being able to choose to engage with content on your own terms, so please make sure to put mature and potentially sensitive content behind the CW feature with enough description that people know what it's about.

Before signing up, please read our community guidelines. While it's a very broad swath of topics it covers, please do your best! We believe that as long as you're putting forth genuine effort to limit harm you might cause ‚Äì even if you haven't read the document ‚Äì you'll be okay!

Description:
Welcome to the ◊ê community!

Hosted and managed in üá´üá∑ France.

First, here are the main ideas behind our rules that should be yours:

  • The respect of others is primary.
  • This instance wants to be peaceful and welcoming.
  • Each user is responsible of their account.

Rules of Aleph.land

You can be suspended for:

  • Sharing content that is illegal in France (pedophilia, mainly).
  • Taking part of a harassment.
  • Putting someone in danger.
  • Having a racist, sexist, discriminating or oppressive talk.
  • Voluntarily degrading the prosperity or the good atmosphere of the instance.

You can be muted from the public timelines for:

  • Posting a media, some text or a link to the following contents without an explicit content warning and NSFW cover:
    • nudity (#nude)
    • gore (#gore)
    • pornography (#porn)
    • a flashy media that could be harmful for photosensitive people (#epilepsywarning)
    • spoil (#spoil)
  • Unpleasant shitposting or flooding.
  • Making abusive ads.
  • Posting automatic toots from another source.

Please keep in mind that these rules are here to guarantee a good experience to everyone on the instance. Also, this list is not exhaustive and moderators will do their best to solve problems that may not have been specified here.

If you have any question, or suggestion, don't hesitate to contact me at @Madeorsk@aleph.land! :)

You can also donate every month to help me to maintain this instance: liberapay.com/Aleph.LAND
Short: A small island of the fediverse. ◊ê

Description:
Goug√®re ?

Vous vous trouvez sur l'instance Mastodon de Goug√®re, un r√©seau informatique g√©r√© sur notre temps libre. L'instance est maintenue par @papaeng89 et @yapret.

Le serveur se trouve dans un datacenter d'OVH dans ch'Nord.

Quelques r√®gles

De mani√®re g√©n√©rale, les utilisateurs de cette instance sont invit√©s √† respecter la Netiquette (telle que d√©crite dans la RFC 1855).

Les contenus NSFW sont autoris√©s seulement s'ils sont tagg√©s comme tels et l√©gaux en France, de m√™me que les spoilers pouett√©s doivent l'√™tre sous Content Warning explicite. Il est souhaitable que chacun tente, dans la mesure du possible, de ne pas flooder, notamment sur les timelines publiques.

La libert√© des uns s'arr√™te l√† o√π commence celle des autres. Si quelqu'un empi√®te sur la v√¥tre, vous pouvez le bloquer et/ou le signaler aux administrateurs, qui se chargeront, avec l'avis de la communaut√©, de prendre les mesures n√©cessaires.

Nous aider

L'acc√®s √† l'instance est gratuit et le restera, mais le r√©seau Goug√®re a un co√ªt. Pour nous aider √† le supporter, c'est par l√† : https://www.patreon.com/yapret

Cr√©dits

Description:
oc.todon.fr est une instance Mastodon principalement francophone et avec une mod√©ration active.

R√®gles :

Aucun type de harc√®lement ou de (micro-)agression n'est tol√©r√©, qu'elles soient personnelles ou rel√®vent d'un syst√®me oppressif (misogynie, racisme, LGBTphobies/queerphobie, validisme, etc.). De m√™me pour la promotion de ces oppressions et des mouvements politiques associ√©s (masculinisme, supr√©macisme, etc.).

La pornographie et la nudit√© doivent √™tre obligatoirement indiqu√©es comme "NSFW". De m√™me pour contenus sensibles/choquants, qui doivent avoir un Content Warning appropri√©.

Sauf exception accord√©e par l'admin, les publicit√©s sont bannies de cette instance.

Enfin, vous devez respecter les lois fran√ßaises, y compris celles concernant les droits d'auteurs.

√Ä propos de cette instance :

Cette instance est maintenue sur mon temps libre, et je ne souhaite pas me faire r√©mun√©rer pour cela. Cependant, je dois louer le mat√©riel, et vous pouvez me donner un coup de main sur Liberapay si vous le souhaitez.

Pour suivre les mises √† jour de l'instance, abonnez-vous au compte @admin. Vous pouvez aussi me contacter via ce compte, ou par email √† l'adresse progval+octodon arobase progval point net (GPG: 3790 43E3 DF96 D323 7E67 82AC 0E08 2B40 E437 6B1E).

Les listes d'utilisateurices et d'instances bloqu√©-es et silenci√©-es ne sont pas visibles publiquement pour √©viter des plaintes pour diffamation. Elles sont en revanche disponibles sur demande en message priv√© √† @admin ou par email.

Inscription avec une adresse email Microsoft

Microsoft a d√©cid√© que tous les emails venant de mon serveur sont du spam, malgr√© une configuration correcte, une adresse IP de bonne r√©putation, et avoir contact√© Microsoft. Il est donc impossible de s'inscrire avec des adresses Outlook, Hotmail, Live, ou MSN.

Mentions l√©gales

Ce site web est h√©berg√© √† titre non lucratif par Val Lorentz sur un serveur lou√© en France chez SCALEWAY SAS BP 438 75366 PARIS CEDEX 08 FRANCE. Les contenus pr√©sents sur ce site sont uniquement la responsabilit√© de leur auteurice.

Description:
ACP Code of Conduct

General rules

  • All forms of transphobia, misogyny, homophobia, racism, fat-shaming, ableism, engaging in targeted harrasment, and any kind of oppressive slurs are strictly prohibited.
  • Our servers are under French jurisdiction. French laws do apply here.
  • Porn and nudity are allowed, but must have a CW. Lolicon and sexual discussions or depictions of minors are never allowed.
  • Parody accounts are allowed, and must be identified as such in their description or name.
  • Cross posting from a twitter account is allowed but must be set to unlisted or private. It must include a content warning if the subject requires it, or if the crossposter does not support them, you should take care to prefix your tweets with a "CW:" or "TW:".

Reporting content / abuse

You can report a toot by using the built-in "report" button, which appears under every toot ("three dots" button). Please include a descriptive comment, so we can better understand what's going on.

Sanctions

Toots violating our Code of Conduct can be removed by moderators. Depending on the reported violation, your account may be suspended or silenced.

Moderators

  • @a000d4f7a91939d0e71df1646d7a48
  • @Butch2Therapie

We are anticapitalist, but unfortunately capitalism isn't dead yet. Currently, it costs $58.80/month for Hugo's services, including server hosting. Donations can be made at Patreon, PayPal Thank you for any help you're able and willing to share!

Toot Caf√© is an instance that was seeded from the web development and design community, so topics may tend to be about JavaScript, CSS, etc. They're not limited to that, though; you can talk about anything you want as long as you follow the Code of Conduct.

Code of Conduct

Prior art

  • Mastodon.social guidelines
  • JSConf Code of Conduct

The short version

  • Don't harass anyone
  • If someone is harassing you, report it to a moderator
  • Have fun
  • Be excellent to each other

Moderators

Current

  • @nolan

Retired

  • @ohhoe
  • @halkeye
  • @luisbg

Rules

  • No advertising or excessive promotion
  • No bots, unless they're cute, funny, or useful. Bots should avoid posting to the public timeline.
  • No pornography, nudity, or something that would be considered "NSFW" in a U.S. workplace, even behind a NSFW warning.
  • No gore or graphic violence
  • Content that is borderline NSFW or could be construed as NSFW at a glance should be put behind a CW (Content Warning)
  • No racism
  • No sexism
  • No discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), caste, or national origin
  • No xenophobia or violent nationalism
  • No sexual depictions of children
  • No holocaust denialism, Nazi symbolism, promotion of National Socialism, or anything that is illegal in the European Union
  • No stalking or harassment
  • No fake accounts, even celebrity joke accounts. Note this rule does not necessarily apply to remote accounts.
  • No "follow bots." We block these and our instance is on a "no bots" list.

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "‚Ä¶" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't; brands and non-humans (other than fun/useful bots) are banned. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your service‚Ä¶ none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!)

More privacy measures on toot.cafe:

  • EXIF data (GPS location, date, camera type, etc.) is stripped from images and never stored.
  • All crawlers are blocked in robots.txt.
  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.

Understand though that this instance is run by me and my friends, and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) we potentially have access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

Also, for truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no E2E encryption. So use Signal or Matrix for the things you really want to be private.

Discussion and Feedback

For questions about policy, bots, design, theming, etc., please refer to our discussions GitHub repo.

Blocked instances

We block some other instances. I used to maintain a list here for transparency, but later decided it's not really worth it. It just gives extra publicity to those instances (even if I attempt to hide the names somewhat) and invites drama.

Just know that we basically block the same instances that most other reasonable instances block. If you feel that something should be blocked, but isn't, reach out to a moderator and/or proactively block it yourself on your own account.

About this server

The main purple theme and custom icons are by Maxime Le Conte des Floris. The Windows 95 theme is by @chr@cybre.space. The "Paris mon Amour" theme is by @ashfurrow@mastodon.technology. The Photon themes are by Sorin Davidoi.

This server is located near Seattle and is maintained by Nolan Lawson.

Toot Caf√© has a Patreon. Thanks for your support!

For DMCA/copyright issues, please contact nolan@nolanlawson.com.
Short: A Mastodon instance mostly populated by folks interested in web design and development.

Description:
Goal of this instance

This is a generalist instance. Either you like Game of Thrones or not, either you support the house Targaryen or not, and whatever opinions you have, you will always be welcome. This instance was made because we believe in a better and decentralised (sine qua non condition) Internet. This instance also focus on security (through a strong TLS configuration) and performance.

This instance is up and running since the 1 April 2017. We were one of the first Mastodon instances open to registrations and we're here for a long time...

All languages are accepted but the main languages spoken here are french and english (and valyrian for sure).


Source code changes

For your information, this instance is running a little different code than other Mastodon instances. Don't panic, it's still Mastodon, but as you can see the look is tweaked. Bio length was increased from 160 to 400. The current limit of characters per post is set to 800 (default is 500 for Mastodon) : we believe this is still a reasonable limit for micro-blogging.

Rules

There are no restrictions of content on this instance, however, to keep it pleasant to everyone here are a few rules.

Any user not respecting these rules may get silenced or suspended.

Also remember you have the ability to report users if they don't respect these rules.

  • Racist, sexist, homophobic, etc. messages are prohibited
  • Parodic accounts are accepted but must mention they are parodic in their description
  • Bots are allowed. However, bots tooting in the public timelines may get silenced if they toot too much. Bots mentionning users too many times without their consent may get suspended.

How to donate?

Liberapay : donate recurrently!

Patreon : become a patron!

To guarantee the longevity of this instance, every single donation is useful.

Instance Administration

  • Woozle: Supreme Uberwensch, general support, web hostess

The Project:

  • Mew, the TootCat wiki (includes site status)
    • Send Us Capitalist Value Tokens

Code of Conduct
Short: On the internet, everyone knows you're a cat ‚Äî and that's totally okay.

The access is open for everyone, but the moderation will be strict about cases of bad behaviour on the instance, which includes having offensive words (sexist, racist, LGBTQI+phobic, or judged as oppressive in any way) and the cases of cyber-harrassing toward an user. Moreover, any content manifestly illegal (based on the french and european laws) will be removed.

Zaclys

Description:
Welcome!

Welcome to Mastodon.me.uk, a social media community hosted in the UK; part of the Fediverse/ActivityPub/Mastodon federated social network, which allows you to follow users on other communities. It's a bit like Twitter but without a single company in control.

If you're new to the Fediverse, the FediTips beginners' guide is a great introduction.

Arriving from Twitter?

If you're coming from Twitter, here are a few useful tools:

  • Find people you know over there by connecting your accounts up to Fedifinder or Twitodon.
  • Many thing you might consider "missing features" are intentional; for instance, quoting other posts is intentionally not possible. Try to get comfy and learn a bit about the space before suggesting it should change.

Fediverse Etiquette (Fediquette?)

  • Use content warnings on posts that people might prefer not to see (politics most often, but you'll see many other examples). It's easy and polite.
  • Don't crosspost indiscriminately between networks.
  • #PutHashtagsInCamelCase, it makes them easier to read for everyone.
  • Add descriptions to your images. Object-Action-Context is a great method.

How We Moderate Content

Your moderation team is @Floppy, @CatherineFlick, @Darkedge, @pauljrobinson, and @jezhiggins. We hope to move to a democractically-elected mod team at some point when we work out how.

The moderation team on this instance are responsible for enforcing our Code of Conduct (see below). In general, our approach is to let people say what they like (unless clearly illegal), but prevent them saying it publicly where it can hurt others. We think that's best aligned with the principles of the Fediverse as a whole.

  1. People that clearly breach UK law (or who are considered spammers by the mods) will be removed immediately.
  2. People that attack other people or groups based on who they are (not for what they believe) will be suspended - that basically means they'll be silenced, and fully deleted after 30 days.
  3. People that post offensive content, or who post regularly without using an appropriate content warning will be limited, making their posts only visible to their followers.
  4. People that have previously posted offensive content on other networks (including Twitter) may be pre-emptively moderated here, though in general we will limit rather than suspend until the accounts actually breach the guidelines on this network.
  6. Servers that fail to meet similar standards of moderation will be limited, though we much prefer to limit individuals if we can.
  7. Servers that encourage offensive content will be blocked.

These principles apply to both local users and federated content, though obviously we can only take the ultimate action to delete content for local users.

We will react to reports as quickly as we can, though please remember we are humans and cannot always respond straight away (especially at night). And of course, we can only respond if we know about infringements, so please use the report button!

Funding

This is a volunteer-run community administered by @Floppy, and hosted by Mythic Beasts in the UK at Canary Wharf. Please support our running costs by joining the Open Collective and becoming a backer. Thanks go to our existing backers - this place exists because of them!

Service Status

Service status is available from our status page, and service updates will normally be posted as server announcements which you will see at the top of your home timeline.

Code of Conduct

Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as contributors and maintainers pledge to making participation in our project and our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, level of experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, class, or sexual identity and orientation.

Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment include:

  • Using welcoming and inclusive language
  • Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
  • Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
  • Focusing on what is best for the community
  • Showing empathy towards other community members

Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

  • The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or advances
  • Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal attacks
  • Public or private harassment
  • Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or electronic address, without explicit permission
  • Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting

Our Responsibilities

Server admins are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.

Server admins have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or permanently any contributor for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Scope

This Code of Conduct applies both within project spaces and in public spaces when an individual is representing the project or its community. Examples of representing a project or community include using an official project e-mail address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event. Representation of a project may be further defined and clarified by project maintainers.

Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported by contacting the administrator at @floppy. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The project team is obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident. Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Server maintainers who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other members of the project's leadership.

Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available at http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4.

Colophon

Marmite emote from Smashicons.
Short: Open, user-supported, corporation-free social media for the UK.

Description:
Code of Conduct

Prior art

  • Mastodon.social guidelines
  • JSConf Code of Conduct
  • Toot Caf√© guidelines

The short version

  • Don't harass anyone
  • If someone is harassing you, report it to a moderator
  • Have fun
  • Be excellent to each other

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "‚Ä¶" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Moderators

  • @tek
  • @cylb
  • @edd
  • @szakib

Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't; brands and non-humans (other than fun/useful bots) are banned. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your service‚Ä¶ none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!)

Understand though that this instance is run by me and my friends, and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) we potentially have access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

Also, for truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no E2E encryption. So use Signal or WhatsApp for the things you really want to be private.

More privacy measures on Free Radical:

  • Our robots.txt file asks crawlers not to explore the site.
  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.

About this server

Free Radical is a Digital Ocean droplet in San Francisco. It's maintained by Kirk Strauser. Thanks for visiting!

Moderation notes

These are longer explanations of comments in the Unavailable content section below.

  1. This is purely a practical matter. These instances have been decent neighbors.
  2. I took a poll of local users, and the overwhelming response was that Free Radical residents wanted to preemptively defederate from Gab and its friends.

Compliance

We are not subject to either the CCPA or GDPR. While we support privacy laws and strive to meet or exceed the requirements of the major ones we know about, they do not apply to us. As such, we will not reply to requests regarding them.
Short: Infosec and privacy and technology and leftward politics and cats and dogs and...

Description:
Bienvenue !

Shelter est une instance Mastodon d√©di√©e aux geeks en tout genre, fans d'animation japonaise, de manga, de jeu vid√©o, de technologie, de r√©tro-gaming, bref, de plein de choses. Les discussions s√©rieuses de la vraie vie sont aussi les bienvenues.

Contenu interdit

Spam

La publicit√©, sous forme r√©p√©t√©e et/ou intrusive (faisant mention d'autres utilisateur¬∑ices), n'est pas accept√©e. Les comptes concern√©s seront rendus invisibles aux flux locaux et f√©d√©r√©s, ou supprim√©s, selon la gravit√© de la situation.

Contenu inappropri√©

Sont interdits les propos, images ou vid√©os racistes, sexistes, homophobes ou transphobes, la d√©sinformation avec intention de tromper (non parodique quoi), le harc√®lement, les propos injurieux et/ou diffamatoires calmonieux, le doxxing, ou le retournement d'une oppression syst√©mique.

P√©dopornographie

Conform√©ment aux lois fran√ßaises et √† la jurisprudence, les contenus p√©dopornographiques, y compris sous forme dessin√©e, sont ill√©gaux et seront supprim√©s, et les comptes ou domaines concern√©s limit√©s (diff√©rent d'un blocage) (si distants) ou supprim√©s (si locaux).

Contenu sensible sans warning

La nudit√©, les contenus √©rotiques, pornographiques ou visiblement violents doivent √™tre marqu√©s avec le drapeau "sensible / sensitive" par respect pour les autres utilisateurs. Les comptes ne respectant pas cette r√®gle seront avertis puis supprim√©s selon la gravit√© et la r√©p√©tition de l'infraction.

Comptes promotionnels

Les comptes visant √† faire la promotion de produits ou de services sont OK tant qu'ils ne spamment pas trop leur contenu et restent dans le th√®me de l'instance. Si possible, contactez l'administration de l'instance (voir plus bas) avant de cr√©er un compte √† cet effet, juste pour √©viter que l'on tire √† vue. Shelter n'a pas pour vocation √† devenir un panneau publicitaire, mais il peut y avoir des exceptions.

Mod√©ration

L'√©quipe de mod√©ration re√ßoit et r√©pond √† tous vos signalements et vous encourage sinc√®rement √† utiliser cette proc√©dure d√®s que vous en ressentez le besoin.

Les d√©lais de traitement varient car nous sommes des √™tres humains avec une vie √† c√¥t√© mais nous faisons de notre mieux pour faire de cette instance un lieu agr√©able pour toutes et tous.

Toute instance probl√©matique, qu'elle soit rep√©r√©e par l'√©quipe de mod√©ration ou signal√©e, pourra faire l'objet de 2 sanctions :

  • La limitation : il s'agit d'un blocage partiel au niveau du fil global de Shelter. Vous pouvez toutefois vous abonner aux comptes de cette instance et leur contenu appara√Ætra dans votre timeline. Nous appliquons cette sanction lorsque nous consid√©rons que l'int√©gralit√© de l'instance n'est pas √† exclure.

  • La suspension : il s'agit d'un blocage total du contenu de cette instance et plus aucune interaction avec elle n'est possible depuis Shelter que ce soit depuis le fil global ou votre timeline.

Dans un souci de transparence, chaque sanction sera motiv√©e par une raison bas√©e sur le r√®glement de Shelter.

Si vous pensez que nous avons fait une erreur (l'instance a chang√© de comportement, d'√©quipe, a appliqu√© de nouvelles r√®gles de mod√©ration, etc.) n'h√©sitez pas √† nous le signaler.

Respect du Contrat de Serveur Mastodon

Shelter respecte le Contrat de Serveur Mastodon qui consiste entre autres √† s'engager √† :

  • Faire des backups r√©guliers des donn√©es

  • Lutter contre tous les types de contenu malveillant

  • Avertir 3 mois √† l'avance les utilisateurs si l'instance venait √† fermer.

Suivez le lien ci-dessus pour plus d'information sur le Contrat.

Page d'√©tat

Vous pouvez consulter l'√©tat des services de Shelter (dont cette instance) sur https://status.mahoro-net.org

Contact

En cas de panne de l'instance ou pour toute question, vous pouvez nous retrouver de multiples fa√ßons :

Mail

Voir l'adresse dans la partie "Contacter l'administrateur"

Twitter

Au cas o√π : AxelTerizaki sur Twitter (ce compte n'est pas souvent consult√© mais les notifications pour les mentions sont activ√©es)

Discord

En plus du mail et de Mastodon, en cas de probl√®me il y a le serveur Discord "L'Abri de la Nanami" que vous pouvez rejoindre. Le canal #le-bureau sert √† parler de l'instance.

Sinon pour me contacter directement : cherchez @axelterizaki

Credits

Artwork en-t√™te de l'instance par Goku !
Short: Bienvenue sur Shelter ! Au menu, discussions adultes, otaku et geek, avec des gens sympas et dans le plus grand respect possible.

Description:
Languages: English, Fran√ßais, Nederlands

Welcome

Welcome on the Mastodon instance hosted by the Pirate Party Belgium (PPBe).

We host this instance so that people who feel they are Pirates can have a nice space for them in the Fediverse. You don't have to agree with everything in our basic text, but it will give you a good overview of what a Pirate is and what our values are.

Please read our Code of Conduct before joining us. It might sound harsh, but there are thousands of other instances and you can even host your own.

The instance server is paid with PPBe money and is maintained by the ITSquad. As for any IT service, the expenses are publicly displayed on our wiki page. The people running this instance are volunteers, so please do take it into account before complaining. Do not hesitate to contribute if you appreciate what we do!

There will be a lot of politics, free software and rainbows on your timeline if you decide to join us üåàüåàüåà

Code of Conduct

v1.0, 13th June 2020

If you want to contribute to this Code of Conduct, you can contact the @ppbe account with what you would like to change. You can also join us at our monthly Pirate Lab!

This Code of Conduct aims to define some guidelines so that this Mastodon instance stays a pleasant place to be. It's not a rulebook, as things are rarely black & white anyway. We expect you to agree to this Code of Conduct and, with time, to grow trust in the moderation team who has to make it a concrete reality with your help.

First thing to know is that each user has their own moderation tools. If you have an issue with another user (from whatever instance) or with a whole other instance, you can discuss with them, mute them or block them.

It's a good idea to report the problematic behaviour only when you think they disrespect the guidelines below. The moderation team will then consider taking actions against them, and can either discuss, warn, mute or block them to prevent them from interacting with anyone from our instance (see section "How is moderation handled?").

Changes to this Code of Conduct will be announced on the @ppbe account. Users who want to discuss about the moderation can send a message to the @ppbe account. New users on our instance are following that account automatically to be informed.

Guidelines

Users from our instance and users who are interacting with us are expected to follow these basic human decency guidelines:

  1. No illegal stuff according to Belgian law
  2. No spamming, which includes using our instance for referencing
  3. Be respectful to other people. For example:
    1. No bully / no harassment
    2. Respect people's gender / pronouns
    3. Assume good faith
    4. Respect their privacy (no scraping the timelines, don't post private/direct messages public, ...)
    5. Avoid posting graphic violence and porn in public timelines without content warning.

In addition, by creating an account on our instance, we strongly recommend that you agree with these guidelines specific to our instance:

  1. Bots and community managed accounts are tolerated as long as you don't post on the public timeline (i.e. followers-only or unlisted). If you plan to publish on the public timeline, please contact us first;
    1. Pirate Party related accounts who wish to publish on the public timelines can also consider checking with one of the other instances run by Pirates
  2. Crossposting from Twitter is tolerated, but we recommend to:
    1. Avoid crossposting retweets (it's unreadable anyway),
    2. Use the followers-only mode if you post often on Twitter, so you don't flood the public timeline;
  3. Use, when possible, an alternative to publishing links to surveillance capitalism websites (like Facebook, Twitter...). Also please try to clean the URL you publish (e.g. don't use URL-shorteners, remove things like "?fbclid=") so you don't become complicit of surveillance.

Being a member of the Pirate Party or contributing to the Pirate Party does NOT absolve you to respect these guidelines.

How is moderation handled?

First, the moderation team discuss about which action should be taken regarding the problematic account. Usually, they try to contact the person in order to explain what is the problem, and to clarify if needed. Once a consensus is reached within the moderation team, they can decide whether to block or mute the account.

In the case of spamming, harassment, bullying, porn without content warning and, in some case, illegal stuff, a moderator can decide by themself to block or mute the account. However, this action will be reported to the moderation team. A discussion may follow to see if this was the right action to take.

The moderation team can decide to block or mute a whole instance when they feel the community is problematic. For example, they would mute any dedicated porn instance where users don't use content warnings. They would block instances that don't respect users privacy, or that are dedicated to bullying, fascism, etc. If they have solid information about that instance, they might react preventively (e.g. a known fascist community opens an instance).

Whenever an instance is blocked or muted, a public statement is made with the PPBe account. The list of moderated instances (blocked or muted) can be consulted at the bottom of this page.

Who is a moderator and how can I contact them?

The list of moderators of our instance is made available : on this pinned toot

What if I don't agree with the decision?

The moderation team works in good faith and tries to take the best decisions using the current guidelines. If you think we made a mistake, don't hesitate to tell us.

If eventually, you still disagree with the moderation team's decision, please remember that there are many other available Mastodon instances.

I want to help!! How can I become a moderator?

The instance members who wish to become moderator can apply to join the moderation team. This application will be considered by the moderation team.

As there must be a good vibe within the moderation team, it is up to them to decide whether to include a new member or not (co-optation).

Nous h√©bergeons cette instance afin de permettre aux personnes se d√©finissant comme Pirates d'avoir un espace agr√©able pour elles sur le Fediverse. Veuillez lire notre Charte avant de nous rejoindre. Cela peut sembler s√©v√®re, mais il y a des milliers d'autres instances, et vous pouvez m√™me cr√©er votre propre instance.

Le serveur qui h√©berge l'instance est pay√© avec l'argent du PPBe et est g√©r√© par l'ITSquad. Comme pour tous nos services informatiques, les d√©penses sont publi√©es sur notre page wiki. Charte

v1.0, 13 juin 2020

Si vous d√©sirez contribuer √† cette Charte, vous pouvez contacter le compte @ppbe avec vos changements. Vous pouvez √©galement nous rencontrer lors de nos Pirate Labs mensuels!

Cette Charte a pour but de d√©finir quelques r√®gles de bonne conduite, ceci afin que cette instance Mastodon reste un endroit agr√©able. Ce n'est pas un texte de Loi, les choses n'√©tant jamais simples de toute fa√ßon. Nous attendons de vous que vous soyez d'accord avec cette Charte et, avec le temps, que votre confiance grandisse en l'√©quipe de mod√©ration qui a la t√¢che, avec votre aide, d'en faire une r√©alit√© concr√®te.

La premi√®re chose √† savoir est que chaque membre de l'instance dispose de ses propres outils de mod√©ration. Si vous avez des soucis avec une autre personne (peu importe son instance) ou avec une instance enti√®re, vous pouvez discuter avec elle, la masquer ou la bloquer.

Il est conseill√© de ne signaler le comportement probl√©matique d'une personne que si vous pensez qu'elle ne respecte pas les r√®gles ci-dessous. L'√©quipe de mod√©ration envisagera alors les actions √† prendre √† ce sujet et pourra en discuter avec la personne en question, l'avertir, la masquer ou la bloquer afin de l'emp√™cher de continuer √† interagir avec quiconque sur notre instance (voir aussi la section "Comment la mod√©ration est-elle g√©r√©e ?").

Les changements √† cette Charte seront annonc√©s via le compte @ppbe . Les personnes qui veulent discuter de la mod√©ration peuvent envoyer un message au compte @ppbe. Toute personne qui nous rejoint sur l'instance suit automatiquement ce compte, ceci afin de rester inform√©¬∑e.

R√®gles de bonne conduite

Il est attendu des personnes utilisant notre instance et de celles qui interagissent avec nous qu'elles respectent ces r√®gles de bonne conduite permettant de pr√©server une dignit√© humaine de base :

  1. Pas de contenu ill√©gal selon le droit belge
  2. Pas de spam, y compris le fait d'utiliser notre instance pour du r√©f√©rencement
  3. Soyez respecteux¬∑se envers les autres personnes. Par exemple :
    1. Pas d'intimidation/pas de harc√®lement
    2. Respectez le genre/pronoms des autres personnes
    3. Supposez la bonne foi
    4. Respectez leur vie priv√©e (pas d'extraction des donn√©es des flux (scraping), pas de publication des messages priv√©s/directs,...)
    5. √âvitez de publier des images de violence explicite et du porno dans les flux publics sans avertissement pr√©alable (content warning)

De plus, en cr√©ant un compte sur notre instance, nous conseillons fortement que vous suiviez les r√®gles suivantes, sp√©cifiques √† notre instance :

  1. Les bots et les comptes g√©r√©s par un ou des community managers sont tol√©r√©s tant que vous ne postez pas dans le flux public (par exemple en "abonn√©¬∑es uniquement" ou "non list√©"). Si vous avez l'intention de publier dans le flux public, prenez contact avec nous au pr√©alable ;
  2. Le crossposting √† partir de Twitter est tol√©r√©, mais nous conseillons de :
    1. √âvitez de crossposter des retweets (c'est illisible de toute fa√ßon) ;
    2. Utilisez le mode "abonn√©¬∑es uniquement" si vous postez souvent sur Twitter, ainsi vous ne noierez pas le flux public ;
  3. Utilisez, si possible, une alternative √† la publication de liens vers des sites web du capitalisme de surveillance (comme Facebook, Twitter...). Essayez aussi de nettoyer les URL que vous publiez (par exemple n'utilisez pas de raccourcisseurs d'URL, supprimez les choses comme "?fbclid="), ainsi vous ne devenez pas complices d'une soci√©t√© de surveillance.

√ätre membre du Parti Pirate de Belgique ou contribuer au Parti Pirate ne vous dispense PAS du respect de ces r√®gles de bonne conduite.

Comment la mod√©ration est-elle g√©r√©e ?

Tout d'abord, une discussion au sein de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration a lieu pour savoir quelle action devrait √™tre prise au sujet de la personne qui pose probl√®me. En g√©n√©ral, l'√©quipe essaie de contacter la personne afin de lui expliquer le probl√®me et de clarifier la situation si n√©cessaire. Lorsqu'un consensus est atteint au sein de l'√©quipe, celle-ci peut d√©cider de bloquer ou masquer le compte.

En cas de spam, d'intimidation, de harc√®lement, ou de porno sans avertissement pr√©alable (content warning), et dans certains cas, de contenu ill√©gal, un¬∑e mod√©rateur¬∑ice peut d√©cider seul¬∑e de bloquer ou masquer le compte. Cependant, cette action sera rapport√©e √† l'√©quipe de mod√©ration. Une discussion pourra s'ensuivre afin de savoir si c'√©tait la bonne mesure √† prendre.

L'√©quipe de mod√©ration peut d√©cider de bloquer ou masquer une instance enti√®re quand elle estime que la communaut√© pose probl√®me. Par exemple, l'√©quipe masquerait une instance d√©di√©e au porno dans laquelle les utilisateurs n'utilisent pas d'avertissement pr√©alable (content warning). L'√©quipe bloquerait des instances qui ne respectent pas la vie priv√©e des utilisateurs, ou d√©di√©es au harc√®lement/√† l'intimidation, au fascisme, etc. Si l'√©quipe a des informations cr√©dibles sur une telle instance, elle peut agir pr√©ventivement (par exemple si une communaut√© fasciste notoire ouvre une instance).

Quand une instance est bloqu√©e ou masqu√©e, une d√©claration est faite sur le compte du PPBe. La liste des instances mod√©r√©es (bloqu√©es ou masqu√©es) peut √™tre consult√©e en bas de cette page.

Qui fait partie de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration et comment entrer en contact ?

La liste des mod√©rateurs se trouvent sur ce message √©pingl√©

Et si je ne suis pas d'accord avec la d√©cision ?

L'√©quipe de mod√©ration fait de son mieux pour prendre ses d√©cisions. Si vous pensez que nous avons fait une erreur, n'h√©sitez pas √† nous le dire.

Si malgr√© tout, vous n'√™tes pas d'accord avec la d√©cision de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration, n'oubliez pas qu'il existe plein d'autres instances Mastodon

Je veux vous aider !! Comment puis-je faire partie de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration ?

Les membres de l'instance qui souhaitent rejoindre l'√©quipe peuvent √©videmment poser leur candidature qui sera √©tudi√©e par l'√©quipe de mod√©ration.

Il doit y avoir une bonne ambiance entre les diff√©rents membres de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration, d√®s lors la d√©cision d'inclure un nouveau membre revient √† l'√©quipe (co-optation).

Description:
Funding

mastodon.org.uk does not show ads, and does not do personalized tracking. It can only exist if people help fund the instance. You can be a Patreon through patreon.com/mastodonorguk. More Patreons equals a better/faster experience and more redundancy in case of failures.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodon.org.uk; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
    4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France and/or the Netherlands, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Description:
Welcome to The Wandering Shop!

The Wandering Shop is a Mastodon instance initially aimed at the science fiction and fantasy community, but open to all. We want our 'local' timeline to have the feel of a coffee shop at a good science fiction convention: tables full of friendly conversation on a wide variety of topics.

Supporting the Wandering Shop

Accounts on the Wandering Shop are free for all users, but the reality is a small collective of volunteers invests time and money in running this instance for all our users. Single or subscription donations are much appreciated. Our one-time or subscription donations links are here:

Flexible Donation

Monthly Subscription - Configurable

The Wandering Shop Code of Conduct

We want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone.

Unacceptable Behavior

The following behavior is not welcome anywhere in The Wandering Shop:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion
  • Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism
  • Promotion of fascist, white supremacist, or hateful ideology or symbolism, including in the choice of a user name or avatar
  • Deliberate, targeted, or persistent misgendering or deadnaming, or promotion of so-called "conversion therapy" and programs of similar intent
  • Threats of violence
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Publishing any individual's address, phone number, or other private identifying information without consent
  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Unwelcome sexual attention, including sharing sexual content with specific users without consent
  • Gratuitous sexual images, textual descriptions or behavior without a content warning
  • Non-consensual distribution of intimate material, graphic or textual, including that generated or augmented by AI programs. If sexually explicit material depicts, names, or simulates an identifiable person as its subject, it shall only be present with the full consent of the subject
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like ‚Äú*hug*‚Äù or ‚Äú*backrub*‚Äù) without consent or after a request to stop
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Continued communications with someone who's asked that you leave them alone
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment

The following behavior is not allowed on the public timeline:

  • Graphic violent or sexual content without a content warning
  • Gratuitous or excessive advertising or spam. It's fine to promote your work, but it shouldn't be the bulk of what you share
  • Fully automated/unattended crossposting or backfilling from any other instance or social media site/application.

Refusing Service:

At our discretion, the admins may ban or silence someone if we believe their presence will be disruptive or create an unpleasant or unwelcoming atmosphere, even if they have not violated the rules of the Wandering Shop. We encourage people to individually mute, block, and/or report accounts they don't want to see, but at our discretion, we may take the additional step of blocking or silencing someone instance-wide if we believe they will undermine the safe and welcoming space we're trying to maintain, wreck the vibe, or give the admins a headache.

Reporting

The current Instance Admins or Owners are:

  • Annalee
  • Johannab
  • Chris R (offby1)
  • Phildini
  • Edebill
  • Shuttermonster

The current Moderators are:

  • Eriophora
  • MikeOfMany
  • Q_Aurelius
  • Eilatan

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, you may reach out to Proprietor or to any Moderator or Admin. They'll respond as promptly as they can.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we‚Äôve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the admins may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from the wandering shop and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom we've received complaints.

Be aware that not every user or post you see in your timeline is a member registered on The Wandering Shop. Users of The Wandering Shop itself are expected to adhere to this Code of Conduct. Users from other instances are not bound by our Code of Conduct, but we may silence or suspend them (thus limiting their visibility on the shop) if they are not contributing to the welcoming and inclusive atmosphere we wish to maintain.

Credits and License

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy.
Short: Wandering.Shop aims to have the vibe of a quality coffee shop at a busy SF&F Convention. Think tables of writers, fans and interested passers-by sharing drinks and conversation on a variety of topics.

Description:
About the rules

Our rules are simple, right?! We will keep this simple.

We welcome everyone on LR, regardless of race, religion or orientation. We welcome debates and conversations, but we do not tolerate personal attacks. The core belief is that we should learn from each other's differences and ideologies. First and foremost, we are all on this instance for one thing: and that is the love for GNU+Linux and Open Source/Free Software.

The people here on LR are a very friendly laid-back group, and we have lots of fun. So come join us! From admins to gamers, from photographers to athletes; we all use GNU+Linux! So bring your hobby or profession, and let's hear about it.

Even the one-eyed one-horned flying purple people eater is welcome here... As long as it uses GNU+Linux...

If you're using GNU+kFreeBSD, GNU+Hurd, BusyBox+Linux, GNU+Linux-Libre or another variant of the GNU system, you're still welcome!

Notice on registration and accounts acceptance

Due to a large amount of spam bots, all registration must be approved. Registration requests without a reason to join may be rejected due to being harder to confirm legitimacy.

Other LinuxRocks Servers

  • PeerTube: https://peertube.linuxrocks.online/
  • XMPP: xmpp://linuxrocks.online (Registration allowed)
  • Jitsi: https://jitsi.linuxrocks.online/ (Registration through XMPP bridge.linuxrocks.online)

If you'd like to donate to LR

  • https://www.patreon.com/linuxrocks
  • https://paypal.me/linuxrocksonline

Code of Conduct

  • Act like an adult.
  • If you want a bunch of legalese to tell you how you should act then maybe we are not a good fit. We are good with being the internet rebels, truly we are. We are happy and we have fun.
Short:
Linux geeks doing what Linux geeks do...

Special thanks go out to Altispeed Technologies for hosting our hardware!
https://www.altispeed.com/

Description:
Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of lgbt.io; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
    4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children, such as loli.
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
  5. Crossposting from other services is currently permitted, with certain conditions:
    1. If crossposting from Twitter, those toots must be posted as Unlisted or Followers-only.
  6. Accounts on lgbt.io are expected to be created with the intention of interacting with the community in some way. Accounts which demonstrate being used primarily under automation or for crossposting may be suspended.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

-- Code of Conduct (obtained from mastodon.social and modified by lgbt.io) last updated on 10th December 2020.

Staff

In addition to the site's owner, @self, lgbt.io's moderation staff include:

  • @codeawayhaley
  • @porsupah
  • @eclectic
  • @mordremoth
  • @celesteh
-- If you are interested in becoming a moderator on lgbt.io, feel free to contact @self.

Support Us

Our server currently costs us ~$80 per month. You can support us on Patreon, LiberaPay or PayPal Me.

Our Supporters

+ @codeawayhaley@lgbt.io
+ Iliana W.
+ @porsupah@lgbt.io
+ Dana R.
+ @Yuki
  • @bootblackCub@lgbt.io
  • @nelson@lgbt.io
  • Thomas B.

  • @sky@lgbt.io

  • Thanks to all current and existing patrons! ❤

-- Our Supporters last updated on 9th October 2020.

Description:
Scholar Social Community Standards

This is a queer-friendly general-purpose federated Mastodon instance. You may use it as a personal account, but the focus is on academics. Scholar Social has been described as "The teacher's break room of the Fediverse."

Real names and credentials are only recommended if you plan to use your account on this instance for networking purposes; they are absolutely not required.

Encouraged uses of Scholar Social

  • Brag about your publications
  • Share references and resources
  • Network with other academics
  • Put it on the last slide of your conference presentation
  • Recruit participants for academic surveys‚Äîformal, IRB-approved ones or even informal ones (just make sure to CW them so that others can consent and don't get too obnoxious about it; see the full Terms of Service for details about other research on Scholar Social members)
  • Satire and activism are welcome here, but they must make a good-faith effort to punch up. ("Punching up": making jokes or criticism at the expense of those with more power, higher status or greater privilege.)
  • Non-academic, "off-topic" stuff is allowed, but try to post this as Unlisted, not as Public

Who is welcome on Scholar Social? Do I need to be a full-time student, teacher or researcher?

The "topic" for this instance is: academia, research, teaching and learning, which is intentionally a very broad topic. You do not need an advanced degree to join (or any degree, for that matter).

If you consider yourself a scholar of any sort, and you are willing to engage with others respectfully, and you will respect our community's efforts to make this a safe space for queer people and other minorities, you are absolutely welcome here.

This instance was specifically started to provide a safe space for queer people and other minorities in academia. Due to the antagonistic relationship that law enforcement has often had with these groups, police officers, military and employees of any law enforcement or intelligence agency are not welcome on this instance.

Introduce yourself!

After signing up, post a message to the Local Timeline telling us who you are, what your academic interests are, and helping us to get to know you better. I have set the administrative account to automatically boost public posts tagged with #introductions. (But if you abuse this by using it for anything else, I will close your account without warning.)

Content Warnings (CW's)

Please add CW's (content warnings) that are accurate and descriptive enough to enable reader consent to the following types of posts:

  • strong language,
  • rants,
  • selfies,
  • current events (includes: US or non-US, local, national, international, and should be applied regardless of whether sources are academic or non-partisan),
  • high-conflict or otherwise exhausting issues of popular debate (e.g. climate change, GMO's, privacy issues, elections, etc.),
  • mentions of death or violence,
  • photographs or illustrations of insects, genitals, wounds (even if they come from a scientific source)
  • references or links to Facebook/Twitter/other big tech companies,
  • spoilers of popular and recent TV shows or other media,
  • ASCII art (this one is important to ensure that someone using a screen reader doesn't have to listen to an attempt to read out a bunch of obscure symbols)
  • stresses particular to academia such as grades, exams, thesis progress, academic job market prospects, and
  • anything else where another user might want to decide for themselves whether or when they want to interact with your post.

There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one.

Image descriptions

It is an expectation of this instance that you add accurate descriptions to all images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is an expectation of this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description.

The Local Timeline

Be conscious of how much space you take up on the Local Timeline. This is the instance's "kitchen table," where we all hang out.

Posts on the Local Timeline (ones with the "Public" privacy setting) will be checked to ensure that Content Warnings are applied, images are described, and other expectations are followed. Unlisted posts will not be proactively reviewed, but will still be subject to rules regarding abuse and other hate-speech.

Make the first post of a thread Public if you want it on the Local Timeline, and subsequent posts Unlisted. We strongly recommend one thread per academic conference, for example.

NOTE: The "official" Mastodon app is NOT recommended for use on Scholar Social, as it does not allow for posting using the "Unlisted" privacy setting.

Use a CW or post as Unlisted if you're not sure that your post is "on-topic." The Scholar Social Local Timeline is not meant to be a current events news aggregator, and if your post seems to fall into this category, you may be asked to delete and re-draft it with a CW or as an Unlisted post. Let's try to avoid turning the Local Timeline into the same rehashing of the outrage-of-the-day that we see on Twitter!

Not every post on the Local Timeline should be CW'd, but most should. Do your best to try to accommodate each other, and try to be understanding when there is a clash of expectations or needs.

Unwelcome conduct on Scholar Social

The following will result in: a warning from the admin or having offending posts deleted, possibly without prior notice.

  • Providing unsolicited advice to strangers
  • Inappropriate un-CW'd posts on the Local Timeline (see above for CW policies)
  • Posts with un-described images or video
  • Shortened links, e.g. bit.ly, t.ly, tinyurl.com, goo.gl, ift.tt, lnkd.in, is.gd or t.co (These are considered malicious because link-shorteners track users without their consent and obscure the destination address, which also prevents users from being able to decide whether they want to visit the link beforehand)
  • Advertisement or apologia for cryptocurrencies, NFT's, or multi-level marketing schemes.

Exceptions:

  • DOI links (e.g. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.k959) are allowed but the post must accurately describe the title/author/journal to allow the reader to decide for themselves whether they would like to follow the link. (In cases of very long titles, you may truncate it, and in cases of long author lists, "First-Author et al" will do.) Posts with DOI links where the target of the link is not described, or not described sufficiently, may be deleted without warning.

Things that will get your account closed, possibly without warning

  • Racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, able-ism, etc. (will result in a permanent ban, you may not receive a prior warning)
  • Serious dishonesty that is hurtful to others (e.g. falsely representing oneself as a member of a minority; services offering to write academic papers to help students cheat; vaccine denialism; predatory conferences or journals; overt pseudoscience such as flat-earther-ism etc.)
  • Anything that could be described as "spam"
  • Impersonating other people
  • Harassment of any kind
  • No bots and no "institutional" accounts operated by non-members please; Scholar Social is for people
  • Accounts that automatically repeat a Twitter account, RSS feed, etc. must post to Scholar Social as Unlisted, not Public

Regarding attempts to abuse these anti-abuse tools and policies

Do not attempt to weaponize our Community Standards or anti-abuse tools/policies against marginalized groups such as people of colour, women or queer people. Users of Scholar Social are expected to have the literacy to understand that "reverse discrimination" is not real, and so attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken deliberately in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that people of colour put CW's on every discussion of race; a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I hate straight people" may find their own account suspended.)

Full terms of service
Short: Microblogging for researchers, grad students, librarians, archivists, undergrads, high schoolers, educators, research assistants, profs‚Äîanyone involved in learning who engages with others respectfully

Wij verwelkomen anarchisten, socialisten, (klimaat)activisten, LHBTQIA+-personen, milieubewuste mensen, intersectionelen, antiracisten, antifascisten, antikapitalisten, veganisten, piraten, mensenrechtenactivisten, enz. Als ze maar radicaal, links √©n anti-autoritair zijn.

Solange sie radikal, links √∫nd antiautorit√§r sind.

Todon.nl is a radical leftist anti-authoritarian Mastodon server. We welcome anarchists, socialists, (climate) activists, the LGBTQIA+ community, environmentalists, anti-racists, anti-fascists, anti-capitalists, intersectionalists, vegans, pirates, human rights activists, etc. As far as they are radical, leftist and anti-authoritarian.

Learn more ‚ü∂

Todon.nl es un servidor de Mastodon de izquierda radical antiautoritaria. Damos la bienvenida a anarquistas, socialistas, activistas (clim√°ticos), personas del colectivo LGBTQIA+, ambientalistas, anti-racistas, anti-fascistas, anti-capitalistas, interseccionalistas, veganxs, piratas, activistas por los derechos humanos, etc. Siempre que sean radicales, de izquierdas y antiautoritarios.

Saber m√°s ‚ü∂

Welkom op Todon.nl! Lees eerst onze uitgebreide gebruiksvoorwaarden (inclusief onze regels) en ons privacybeleid.

Om een idee te geven ‚Äì wij accepteren (onder andere) geen: racisme, seksisme, homofobie, transfobie, seksisme, validisme en andere vormen van discriminatie, lastig vallen van mensen, haatzaaien, getrol, (seksueel) misbruik van minder- en meerderjarigen (ook niet virtueel), verheerlijking van geweld, militarisme, nationalisme en rechts-populisme, rechts- en religieus extremisme, tankies (ML), kapitalisten, (rechtse) complot'theorie√´n', hoaxes en uiteraard geen spam en andere vormen van reclame.

Wil je hier een account? Vertel ons precies waarom je je hier wilt aanmelden! Waarom speciaal Todon.nl en niet √©√©n van de vele andere Mastodonservers? We willen vooral weten wat voor linkse politieke overtuiging je hebt, zodat we kunnen zien of deze compatibel is met die van ons. Help ons gewoonweg om onze taak om jouw aanvraag goed te keuren eenvoudiger te maken.

Deze Mastodonserver is de tweelingserver van Todon.eu. Ze worden beiden beheerd en gemodereerd door een klein collectief van vrijwilligers. Wij accepteren alle talen, hoewel Engels, Nederlands, Duits en Spaans het populairst zijn op deze Mastodonserver. Moderatie is in het Engels, Nederlands, Spaans, Duits, Deens, Zweeds en Noors.

Kenmerken:

  • Maximaal aantal tekens voor toots: 1312 (i.p.v. 500)
  • Zoeklimiet: 11 (i.p.v. 5)
  • Indexering door zoekmachines staat standaard uitgeschakeld
  • Ongeautoriseerde toegang tot de openbare tijdlijn is niet toegestaan
  • Wij houden geen onnodige gegevens bij

Thema's:

  • Todon (donker - standaard):
    • in de eenvoudige webomgeving met √©√©n kolom hetzelfde als het standaardthema van het Mastodonproject.
    • in de geavanceerde webomgeving het standaardthema van het Mastodonproject, maar over de volledige breedte en met enkele kleine aanpassingen (compatibel met de meeste schermresoluties, incl. brede schermen).
  • Mastodon (licht):
    • het lichte standaardthema van het Mastodonproject.
    • in de geavanceerde webomgeving over de volledige breedte, zoals het standaardthema van Todon.nl.
  • Mastodon (hoog contrast):
    • het (donkere) standaardthema van het Mastodonproject in hoog contrast.
    • in de geavanceerde webomgeving over de volledige breedte, zoals het standaardthema van Todon.nl.

Willkommen auf Todon.nl! Bitte lies zuerst unsere Nutzungsbedingungen (inklusive unserer Regeln) und unsere Datenschutzerkl√§rung.

Um dir einen ersten Eindruck zu vermitteln ‚Äì wir akzeptieren nicht: Rassismus, homophobes und transphobes Verhalten, Sexismus, Ableismus und andere Formen von Diskriminierung, Bel√§stigung, Trolling, Hassrede, (sexuellen) Missbrauch Minderj√§hrige und Erwachsener (auch nicht virtuell), Gewaltverherrlichung, Militarismus, Nationalismus und Rechtspopulismus sowie, rechten und religi√∂sen Extremismus, tankies (ML), Kapitalisten, (rechte) Verschw√∂rungs'theorien', Hoaxes, und nat√ºrlich Spam oder andere Formen von Werbung.

Du m√∂chtest beitreten? Sag uns genau, warum du unserem Server beitreten m√∂chtest! Wieso hast du dich f√ºr Todon.nl entschieden und nicht f√ºr eine der anderen zahlreichen Mastodon-Instanzen? Insbesondere w√ºssten wir gerne, welchen linken Anschauungen ihr euch zugeh√∂rig f√ºhlt, um zu sehen, ob diese mit den unsrigen kompatibel sind. Diese Auskunft macht es uns leichter, deine Registrierung zu best√§tigen.

Bei uns sind alle Sprachen willkommen, wobei Englisch, Niederl√§ndisch, Deutsch und Spanisch auf dieser Instanz am meisten gesprochen werden. Moderation findet auf Englisch, Niederl√§ndisch, Spanisch, Deutsch, D√§nisch, Schwedisch und Norwegisch statt.

Merkmale:

  • Zeichenbeschr√§nkungen f√ºr Toots: 1312 (anstelle von 500)
  • Suchbeschr√§nkung: 11 (anstelle von 5)
  • Wir speichern keine unn√∂tigen Daten

Farbschemata:

  • Todon (Dunkel - Standard):
    • eine Version des (dunkle) Standardinterfaces von Mastodon in voller Breite (kompatibel mit den meisten Bildschirmaufl√∂sungen, inklusive Breitbild)
  • Mastodon (Hell):
    • Das helle Standardinterface, aber in voller Breite
  • Mastodon (Hoher Kontrast):
    • Das dunkle Hochkontrastschema, aber in voller Breite

Welcome on Todon.nl! Please read first our comprehensive terms of service (including our rules) and our privacy policy.

To give you an idea ‚Äì we do not accept (among other things): racism, homophobia, transphobia, sexism, ableism and other forms of discrimination, harassment, trolling, hate speech, (sexual) abuse of minors and adults (also not virtual), glorification of violence, militarism, nationalism and right-wing populism, right-wing and religious extremism, tankies (ML), capitalists, (right-wing) conspiracy 'theories', hoaxes, and of course no spam and other forms of advertisement.

Want to join us? Tell us exactly why you want to join us! Why especially Todon.nl and not one of the many other Mastodon servers? We especially like to know what kind of leftist political beliefs you have, so that we can see if they are compatible with ours. Just help us to make our job to approve your request easier.

If you don't receive a welcome email in 24 hours, your invite request is (probably) declined.

This Mastodon server is the twin server of Todon.eu. They are both run and moderated by a small collective of volunteers. We accept all languages, although English, Dutch, German and Spanish are the most popular on this server. Moderation is in English, Dutch, Spanish, German, Danish, Swedish and Norwegian.

Features:

  • Character limit of toots: 1312 (instead of 500)
  • Search limit: 11 (instead of 5)
  • Search engine indexing disabled by default
  • Unauthenticated access to public timelines disabled
  • We do not keep unnecessary data

Themes:

  • Todon (Dark - default):
    • in the single column interface the same as the default Mastodon project theme.
    • in the advanced web interface a full width version of the default Mastodon project theme, with some minor modifications (compatible with most screen resolutions, incl. wide screens).
  • Mastodon (Light):
    • the light default project theme
    • full width in the advanced web interface, like the Todon.nl default theme.
  • Mastodon (High contrast):
    • the (dark) high contrast default project theme
    • full width in the advanced web interface, like the Todon.nl default theme.

¬°Bienvenidx a todon.nl! Por favor lee los t√©rminos de servicio (incluyendo nuestras reglas) y nuestra pol√≠tica de privacidad.

Para darte una idea, no aceptamos (entre otras cosas): racismo, homofobia, transfobia, sexismos, capacitismo y cualquier otra forma de discriminaci√≥n, acoso, trolleo, discursos de odio, abuso (sexual) de menores y adultxs (medios digitales incluidos), glorificaci√≥n de la violencia, militarismo, nacionalismo y populismo de derecha, extremismo de derecha y religioso, tankies (M-L), capitalistas, 'teor√≠as' conspirativas (de derecha), bulos y por supuesto spam ni otras formas de publicidad.

¬øQuieres unirte a nosotrxs? Nos gustar√≠a que te tomaras un tiempo en decirnos por que quieres unirte a nosotrxs. ¬øPor qu√© Todon.nl y no otro de los tantos servidores de Mastodon? Especialmente nos gustar√≠a saber cuales son tus l√≠neas pol√≠ticas de izquierda para saber si son compatibles con las nuestras. Ayudanos a que nuestra labor de aprovar tu propuesta sea mas f√°cil.

Aceptamos todos los idiomas, aunque el ingl√©s, holand√©s, alem√°n y castellano son los m√°s populares aqu√≠. Lxs moderadorxs hablan ingl√©s, holand√©s, castellano, alem√°n, dan√©s, sueco y noruego.

Caracter√≠sticas:

  • L√≠mites de caracteres para toots: 1312 (en vez de 500)
  • L√≠mite de b√∫squeda: 11 (en vez de 5)
  • No conservamos datos innecesarios

Dise√±os:

  • Todon (oscuro - por defecto):
    • versi√≥n a ancho completo de pantalla del tema oscuro por defecto de Mastodon, compatible con la mayor√≠a de las resoluciones de pantalla, incluyendo pantallas anchas.
  • Mastodon (claro):
    • el tema claro por defecto, con ancho completo
  • Mastodon (alto contraste):
    • el tema de alto contraste oscuro por defecto, con ancho completo
