√úBER UNS

Willkommen auf einem Mastodon Server der Fediverse Foundation!
Mehr √ºber unseren gemeinn√ºtzigen Verein erfahrt ihr hier: fediverse.foundation

SPENDEN & TRANSPARENZ

Wir stellen die Angebote der Fediverse Foundation werbe- und trackingfrei ehrenamtlich in unserer Freizeit zur Verf√ºgung. Wir bieten unsere Services f√ºr alle Nutzer kostenlos an. Wenn ihr uns unterst√ºtzen m√∂chtet, dann k√∂nnt ihr das in Form einer freiwilligen Spende tun. Mit dem Geld werden prim√§r Domain-, Server-, Strom- und Hardwarekosten gedeckt.

  • Fediverse Foundation - Spenden und Offenlegung
    • IBAN: AT54 2011 1849 4974 3900
  • Fediverse Foundation - PayPal


Vielen Dank f√ºr Eure Unterst√ºtzung!

DAS REGELWERK

Das Regelwerk findet ihr etwas weiter unten im Reiter "Serverregeln" oder direkt in unserer Wiki im Bereich der Serverregeln unserer Instanzen (de/en).

Altersgrenze / Minderj√§hrige

Um unsere Dienste verwenden zu d√ºrfen, musst du das 14. Lebensjahr vollendet haben. Siehe dazu auch das Datenschutz-Anpassungsgesetz 2018.

Keine AI / ML Regelung

Es ist untersagt, Daten oder Inhalte von den unten angef√ºhrten Instanzen f√ºr das Training oder die Entwicklung von Modellen der k√ºnstlichen Intelligenz oder des maschinellen Lernens zu verwenden, ohne die ausdr√ºckliche Zustimmung des Urheberrechtsinhabers einzuholen. Jede unbefugte Nutzung von Daten oder Inhalten f√ºr KI/ML-Zwecke wird als Versto√ü gegen das Urheberrecht betrachtet und kann rechtliche Schritte nach sich ziehen.

Moderierte Sprachen

Unsere Moderatoren versuchen, unabh√§ngig von politischer Ausrichtung, alle Posts gleichwertig und objektiv entlang unserer Serverregeln zu moderieren. Nat√ºrlich ist das nur f√ºr Sprachen m√∂glich, die wir auch verstehen - daher sind als Sprachen auf unseren Instanzen nur Deutsch und Englisch m√∂glich. Wir behalten uns das Einschr√§nken oder L√∂schen von Nachrichten in anderen Sprachen im Zweifel vor.

DATENSCHUTZ

Unsere Offenlegung bez√ºglich Datenschutz entnehmt bitte ebenfalls unserer Wiki dem Bereich Datenschutzerkl√§rung (de/en).

F√∂deration mit Meta (Facebook) / Instagram

Unsere Server haben die F√∂deration mit threads.net pr√§ventiv blockiert. Diese Regel k√∂nnte in Zukunft ge√§ndert werden, wenn wir wissen, wie threads.net die F√∂deration √ºber ActivityPub implementiert und wie sie auf Berichte aus dem Fediverse reagieren.

TECHNISCHE UND ORGANISATORISCHE MASSNAHMEN

Die Angebote der Fediverse Foundation werden als gemeinn√ºtziger Verein und in unserer Freizeit betrieben. Wir erzielen keinerlei Einnahmen mit dem Angebot und finanzieren uns aus Spenden und Eigenmitteln. Wir behalten uns vor, den Dienst jederzeit aus rechtlichen, technischen oder finanziellen Gr√ºnden einzuschr√§nken oder zu beenden.

Ansonsten gilt folgendes:

  • Dieser Server h√§lt sich an die Vereinbarungen f√ºr Mastodon Serverbetreiber: Server Covenant
  • Unsere technischen und organisatorischen Ma√ünahmen k√∂nnt ihr ebenso in unserer Wiki im Bereich f√ºr technische und organisatorische Ma√ünahmen (de/en) nachlesen.

Description:
üëã Velkommen

Velkommen til et sosialt nettverk av mennesker som ble f√∏dt, bor og jobber i den norske hovedstaden Oslo.

P√• samme m√•te som andre sosiale nettverk, kan du lage din egen profil, poste meldinger, bilder, meningsm√•linger, videoer og f√∏lge andre medlemmer.

oslo.town eies og drives av mennesker i Oslo. Det er gratis √• bruke og det er ingen reklame. Det er heller ingen store selskaper som pr√∏ver √• overv√•ke hvert eneste trekk du gj√∏r.

Registrer deg n√• for √• kreve ditt unike brukernavn.

üëã Welcome (English)

Welcome to a social network of people that were born, live, and work in the Norwegian capital of Oslo.

Similar to other social networks, you can make your own profile, post messages, images, polls, videos, and follow other members.

oslo.town is owned and operated by people in Oslo. It's free to use and there's no advertising. There's also no big companies trying to monitor your every move.

Sign up now to claim your unique username.

üß¨ How does this work?

Just like a real town there is lots of things happening in your local area. When you are signed up, clicking the Local / Lokal tab will show you everything that is happening on this website. If you want to explore the wider world, click the Federated / Felles tab to see everything happening across a lot of websites connected to this one.

When you see someone interesting, Follow / F√∏lg that person for future updates. They will appear in your Home / Hjem timeline. You can follow anyone in the whole world - whether they are local or not.

When you see something you didn't want to see, you can Mute / Demp or Block / Blokk√©r that person or the whole website. If you see something on the local timeline which you don't think should be on the internet, you can Report / Rapport√©r it to The Mayor.

For a more geeky insight into how the site works, you can watch this YouTube video or read the Documentation.

üèµÔ∏è The Mayor

When you sign up to the website, you will instantly be following @themayor to get the latest updates straight from the oslo.town town hall. It is highly recommended that you follow The Mayor, but it's your life - do what you want - you can always unfollow them.

üß¢ Merchandise

The lovely people at @lokk in Oslo have embroidered a baseball cap.

If you want one, you can go in the store and order one. Ask the for the oslo.town logo (they might need to search their emails for a reference file). Pick out your colour and style of baseball cap. Pay the fine people. And off you go!

üôã FAQ

Who actually runs this site?

The site is run by the user @matt but also pretends to be the character of @themayor. This is also why everything is in English so far - his Norwegian sucks. Sorry about that.

Is this linked to Oslo Kommune?

No. The site is independently run and is not endorsed by Oslo Kommune. The logo of oslo.town is meant to be a parody and tribute to the official Oslo logo, but that is where the link ends. The account @kommune is not currently maintained or monitored by Oslo Kommune.

How much does it cost The Mayor to run oslo.town?

Presently, the main costs are the domain(s), the hosting, and time. But we don't talk about the last one because @themayor is working on a volunteer basis.

  • Domains
    The site is set up on oslo.town which costs 48 GBP per calendar year.
  • Hosting
    The hosting is from masto.host. We currently pay 136 USD per month.
  • Marketing
    Occasionally, oslo.town prints promotional stickers and cards from moo.com which costs 220 NOK per 100 cards, and 240 NOK per 100 stickers. Postage costs not included.

This brings an estimated yearly running cost to a little over 19,000 NOK - which includes domains, hosting, 100 stickers and 100 cards.

How do you pay for this?

We take donations. You can donate via Patreon, Ko-Fi, or PayPal. If you want to send cryptocurrency, you can. And if you are using Brave Web Browser then you can Tip and Contribute through Brave Rewards as you browse the site.

All donations to to the running cost of oslo.town and other projects listed on the Patreon page. The remaining costs are covered by @matt - who is also @themayor.

Why should I use this instead of Facebook / Twitter / etc. ?

Nobody can pretend that oslo.town can replace any popular social networking website, but it's meant to be a nicer alternative. Unlike the big social networking sites, we don't collect your data and sell it. You are not a product. The whole point of this site is community and being able to connect with people locally and globally.

Is my information private?

The goal is to collect as little information about the users as possible and that when information is collected, it is stored for as short time as possible. If you care to, you can read the full Privacy Policy.

To protect your privacy even more, please don't share any personal information with anyone on the site. Think carefully about the username you choose. Share only what you are comfortable sharing.

Please consider how long you wish your posts to be available for. Registered users can set up Automated Post Deletion which will delete your posts after your chosen number of weeks.

Do my posts get listed in Google / Bing / another search engine?

In order to protect your privacy, we have opted-out of listing your profile and toots on search engines. You can turn this on yourself in the settings.

Please be aware that anyone can still screenshot your toots and sites like archive.is or web.archive.org could potentially still create a copy of your publicly listed toots.

How do I only see languages I understand?

When you hit the Federated timeline, you will see many users from around the world speaking their native languages. To filter these views to just languages you know, you should set up the your language preferences.

How do I get featured on the Explore page?

Simple! To get featured on the Explore page, just go to Edit Profile and check the box which says Suggest account to others.

I see offensive content. Can you block it?

If you see an account you see posting offensive content, please use the Block and Report functionality. If this is content that is not hosted on oslo.town then check the option which says Forward to... which will report the account to the appropriate administrator.

Directly from the offensive post, you can also click the option Block Domain which will prevent you from seeing any future content from that website.

We have a set of server rules you should follow. In addition to this, the policy at oslo.town is as follows:

  • We will ensure that bad things don't happen on the Local timeline.
  • We attempt to hide (but not block) any NSFW or spam content from the Federated Timeline.
  • We block any external accounts or domains that are known to frequently spamming our users.
  • Please allow up to 48 hours to process reports.

However, we do not aim to act as your moral compass and will not do domain-wide blocks based on the users of that instance having wild opinions. You should be able to follow anything (even the hidden content) and block these domains or people at your own discretion.

A full list of hidden or blocked domains is published below.
Short: An online home for the people of Oslo, Norway üá≥üá¥ but a gateway to the world.

Description:
Nice people with good intentions are welcome. :) The server is located in Helsinki and is running on Friendica's develop code. An enhanced selection of add-ons and connectors is available. 
You can communicate seamlessly with people from Friendica, Mastodon, Misskey, Pleroma, Diaspora, GnuSocial and follow RSS/Atom feeds. 
Do you also want to use a small cloud storage? There is a Nextcloud and an XMPP server that you can easily use with your Friendica login.

Description:
fAiry.iD is a corner of the vast decentralized federal universe, there is no mandatory topic here, but I hope you will find scientists, engineers, philosophers, musicians, literary scholars, painters, and connect with like-minded people in the federal universe.

We accept and welcome friends from other languages, although most of the active users of this site live in Asia, and the media content is mainly in Chinese.

fAiry.iD pledges to follow the Mastodon 'Server Covenant', in addition to our own moderation 'Server Rules'.All are welcome here!

We take user privacy very seriously, we don't save IPs (change your IP with a LAN IP before sending it to Mastodon) nor do we have access logs, and we don't use Cloudflare.

Description:
Weitere Dienste

  • Mobilizon (Veranstaltungen): rheinneckar.events

Infrastruktur

Zum Schutz eurer Daten besteht mit allen genannten Anbietern ein Auftragsdatenverarbeitungsvertrag (Data Processing Agreement).

  • Server: Hetzner Cloud (Standort Falkenstein)
  • Medienspeicher: ExoScale (Standort Frankfurt)
  • Medienauslieferung: Bunny CDN
  • Domains und Emails: lima-city

Software

Die genutzte Software wird regelm√§√üig aktualisiert und Datenbankbackups t√§glich angelegt.

  • Ubuntu 22.04 LTS
  • Docker 26.1
  • Mastodon 4.2
  • Caddy 2.7
  • Postgres 14
  • Redis 6
  • Elasticsearch 7

Impressum

68161 Mannheim

Short: We're a community of folks who celebrate the craft of creating interactive experiences, whether they're working in games or around them! This is a space for games folks and creatives to call home!

Description:
Bolha.us About

Welcome to bolha.us Mastodon!

Mastodon Limits

  • 1200 Chars for posts
  • 1200 Chars for Bio
  • 12 Metadata Bio Fields
  • 12 Poll Options

About Browser version

Read in your browser here.

Leia esse about em seu browser aqui.

English

This is a Brazilian instance hosted in Canada, initially created for those who speak Portuguese and English. If you want to join our instance, but you don't speak Portuguese or English, you're also welcome, and you can use our universal libretranslator :)

This place was built by people of the Brazilian TECH community that believes we can change our Country; we seek to live in a fair country, without misery, racism, corruption, homophobia, hunger, inequality, a place to include, a humanized space, with human rights for all humans. These are our values.

Here we like to talk about IaC, CI/CD, Dev, Ops, Network, Platforms, Software Engineering, DevOps, GitOps, Containers, Kubernetes, Cloud, and Cloud Native.

This is a Fediverse corner for Geeks, Nerds, Otakus, and tech enthusiasts. Besides the TECH topics, we also like to talk about life, the universe, and everything else.

This is a moderated instance. Our space intent to include everyone, especially minority groups. We are a feminist, anti-fascist, anti-nazi, anti-racist, anti-colonialist community. We are pro-science and pro-LGBTQIA+ and will try our best to be a warm, safe and inclusive space.

Our core values are democracy, social inclusion, digital inclusion, open standards, and the use of open-source software.

We love open-source and prefer to use it, but we also talk about other kinds of tech with different licenses and scopes.

To keep this place safe and healthy, all users should follow our rules, code of conduct, and anti-harassment policy.

Our moderation will work to keep this space safe. Depending on the severity, if they found any post offending our rules, the author could be silenced or suspended.

Visit our site Bolha.io to find more about our community.

Visit our status site status.bolha.us to find more about our services.

Need help to understand what's Mastodon? Then visit mastodon.help to find more about it.

We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Do you need help? Send a message to help@bolha.us or talk with us at matrix on the channel #help:bolha.chat

Fundamental server rules

  • Treat everyone with respect.
  • Treat everyone with kindness.
  • Treat everyone politely.
  • Be excellent to each other.
  • Don't break the laws (Canadian and Brazilian)
  • Don't share protected material, especially software, music, books, photos and videos
  • No fascism.
  • No nazism.
  • No white supremacy.
  • No racism.
  • No colonialism.
  • No nationalism.
  • No religious extremism.
  • No xenophobia.
  • No homophobia.
  • No transphobia.
  • No homophobia.
  • No capacitism.
  • No harrassament.
  • No violence or hate speech.
  • No sexism or misogyny.
  • No LGTBQIA+ Disrespect, this is a safe place for everyone.
  • No Neurodivergent (ADHD, Autism, etc.) Disrespect, this is a safe place for everyone.
  • No SPAM or Flood
  • Please use the tag #aiart and add the tool name in another tag, like #midjourney, when posting IA generated images. In the ALT use the prompt.
  • No Porn.
  • No nudes that are not of your own body, and use content warnings (CW) and tag #NSFW, always
  • If the content is not safe for work, always use sensitive for images, content warning (CW), and the tag #NSFW

Follow our Rules and Conduct Code to be part of our collective or be suspended.

  • https://teammap.bolha.tools

  • https://mermaid.bolha.tools

Draw.io, an editor to create general diagrams

  • https://draw.bolha.tools

Enjoy!

Os moderadores da Bolha pactuam dois compromissos com a comunidade em rela√ß√£o √†s mensagens com audi√™ncia reduzida (mensagens diretas):

Os moderadores da Bolha acessar√£o o conte√∫do de mensagens diretas sempre que e exclusivamente nos casos em que algum dos usu√°rios citados em uma mensagem direta denuncie a publica√ß√£o ou seu autor.

Tais como o mensageiro instant√¢neo Signal ou o utilit√°rio de criptografia OpenPGP.

Es besteht kein Anspruch auf Fortf√ºhrung des Dienstes ohne gesonderte schriftliche Vereinbarung mit der cepharum GmbH. Diese Freiheiten werden durch folgende Einschr√§nkungen begrenzt:

  1. Das Angebot bleibt f√ºr Nutzer kostenfrei.
  2. Eine Aufgabe des Angebots wird mindestens 3 Monate vorab angek√ºndigt, so dass Nutzer die M√∂glichkeit erhalten, ihr Konto auf einen anderen Server zu √ºbertragen.

Die cepharum GmbH erfasst keinerlei Nutzungsdaten dieser Instanz zur Finanzierung dieses Angebots. Alle Kosten werden intern als Werbekosten verbucht und aus Mitteln der cepharum GmbH quersubventioniert.

Als Betreiber des Angebots beh√§lt sich die cepharum GmbH vor, Inhalte und Nutzerkonten zu moderieren, zu sperren oder zu l√∂schen, sofern diese gegen deutsches Recht oder oben genannte Bedingungen versto√üen. Dies umfasst unter anderem die Ver√∂ffentlichung von Beitr√§gen oder Nutzerprofilen mit folgenden Inhalten:

  • diskriminierende, beleidigende oder sonstwie herabw√ºrdigende √Ñu√üerungen
  • Anfeindungen gegen Andersdenkende oder gegen Religionen oder deren Anh√§nger
  • Aufruf zu oder die Darstellung von Straftaten
  • pornografische Inhalte oder die Vermittlung sexueller Kontakte
  • Massenbeitr√§ge zu kommerziellen oder politischen Werbezwecken
  • Bewerbungen f√ºr regional beschr√§nkte Angebote bezogen auf Regionen jenseits des Gro√üraums Berlin/Brandenburg
  • Bewerbung und Verlinkung auf externe Angebote einzig zum Zweck der Suchmaschinenoptimierungen (SEO) jener Angebote
  • die Bewerbung und/oder die Verlinkung von externen Angeboten, welche Aktivit√§ten und Inhalte anbieten, die gegen diese Regeln versto√üen

Wir sch√§tzen die Meinungsfreiheit. Doch diese Instanz ist kein √∂ffentlicher Raum. Es steht jedem frei, selbst Serversysteme zu betreiben, um Beitr√§ge nach eigenen Regeln zum Mastodon-Fediverse beizutragen.

berlin.social is a decentralized alternative to the centrally managed X, formerly Twitter. In opposition to X, Threads, Insta etc. this network is not controlled by a single company, but many independent companies, lots of non-profits and private stakeholders. This way, any commercial exploitation is limited by design while improving the network's stability and data protection. berlin.social is just one out of thousands of instances this network is made of.

This instance is hosted on servers solely located in the EU and it is provided by Berlin-based cepharum GmbH based on its General Terms and Conditions for Hosting Services. The specific data protection terms for this service as well as the data protection terms of cepharum GmbH apply. As a user of this offer, you become a customer of cepharum GmbH within the meaning of the aforementioned terms and conditions.

The offer can be used free of charge. cepharum GmbH is free to adjust the offer at any time and in any way or to discontinue it completely. There is no right to continue the service without a separate written agreement with cepharum GmbH. These freedoms are limited by the following restrictions:

  1. The offer remains free of charge for users.
  2. An abandonment of the offer will be announced at least 3 months in advance, so that users have the possibility to transfer their account to another server.

cepharum GmbH does not collect any usage data of this instance to finance this offer. All costs are booked internally as advertising costs and cross-subsidized from cepharum GmbH funds.

As the operator of the offer, cepharum GmbH reserves the right to moderate, block or delete content and user accounts if they violate German law or the terms and conditions mentioned above. This includes, but is not limited to, the publication of posts or user profile pages with the following content:

  • discriminatory, insulting or otherwise derogatory statements
  • hostility against dissidents or against religions or their followers
  • call for or reproduction of criminal offences
  • pornographic content or the mediation of sexual contacts
  • mass contributions for commercial or political advertising purposes
  • promotions for regionally restricted offers related to regions beyond the greater Berlin/Brandenburg area
  • promotion of and linking to external content for the sole purpose of search engine optimization (SEO)
  • advertising and/or linking to external offers that provide activities and content that violate these rules.

We respect the freedom of speech. But this instance is not a public space. Everyone is free to operate servers themselves in order to contribute to the Mastodon-Fediverse based on their own rules.
Short: Alles rund um, √ºber, aus & f√ºr Berlin

Description:
A US-based community for Veracious Network adult/18+ members, but open to anyone to join. Minors/children are discouraged to join as our language and content is often not suitable for young eyes.

If you are located in one of those states with absurd laws around social media and adult content, check with your local politician to ask if you're legally allowed to access this site.

Feel free to join if you are interested in gaming, technology, compsci, coding, FOSS, like Linux and hate Windows, like Windows and hate Linux, enjoy infosec, or are just bored; we're all pretty easy going. We have a Discord if you'd prefer to chit chat in real time.

NSFW/18+ content is welcome and perfectly fine, just please ensure it is tagged as such.

Absolutely no link building/marketing accounts; these will be deleted immediately.

Loli, racism, transphobia, sexism, homophobia, personal attacks, etc are not tolerated here.

Server operated and managed by the admin team at Veracious Network, SSL provided by LetsEncrypt, and CDN for media hosted on Digital Ocean. Instance running on a private Proxmox cluster on SuperMicro hypervisors near Columbus Ohio.
Short: Veracious Network hosted in central Ohio, US is comprised of folks interested in gaming, technology, science, and open source. 18+ content allowed (only with content warning included)

Description:
sciences.social is an online community for social scientists. Users here can connect with one another and the millions of other Mastodon users who have opted for social media that is ad-free and actively moderated to keep bad actors at bay. Here's how to get started.

1. Create an account

Create an account to get started. You'll be asked to agree to some ground rules. You can post about almost anything on sciences.social, but we don't allow sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia, casteism or abusive behavior.

Once you confirm your email you'll be online. Come on back to this page (sciences.social/about) for next steps.

2. Get an app

Ice Cubes for iOS and Tusky for Android are very good and free. Mona and ivory are excellent apps for iOS/Mac users with a few dollars to spare.

Mastodon also works well from a web browser on laptops and desktops. A browser extension like Graze (chrome, mozilla) or FediAct (chrome, mozilla) will make following folks from other Mastodon servers seamless. Highly recommended.

3. Follow lots of folks

Thousands of social scientists are active on Mastodon, and you can follow anyone regardless of which server they call home. There's no algorithm to fill your feed with content so it helps to follow liberally. Our companion site find.sciences.social makes it easy to find and follow academics from many different disciplines including Sociology, Communication and Media Studies, and Political Science. Followgraph finds folks who are popular among the people you already follow.

You can also follow hashtags like #ASA2023 to see what people are posting about the conference. Or follow #rstats for hints on R and #AcademicChatter for - you know. Or maybe just #NaturePhotography for some pleasant views.

4. Start Posting and Boosting

Introduce yourself with your first post, and include an #introduction hashtag. Post about whatever you want, and use hashtags to make finding your posts easier. If you see a post you like, boost it. There's no algorithm to amplify selected voices here so we rely on boosting to see what's interesting.

More about us

sciences.social welcomes all social scientists, including professors, grad students and anyone with a graduate degree in the social sciences (sociology, anthropology, political science, communications, economics...), including people who are doing qualitative and quantitative work inside or outside academia. We want this to be a comfortable place for social scientists from all backgrounds, including those who are from marginalized or racialized groups, sexual minorities, people with disabilities and others who may not feel welcomed in some academic spaces.

sciences.social is collectively funded. It was started by Mark Igra (@markigra), a PhD student who earned enough money to start the site in a previous career. While Mark will continue to ensure sciences.social is funded, donations have helped pay for the rapid growth of the site. We encourage you to donate through Ko-fi

Mark runs this site with the help of a crew of moderators (Pratik, Kristian, and Simon. Let us know if you would like to help out.

Policies

At the moment, the official rules are deliberately minimal, but they have important implications. First, if you don't understand that "treat people with respect" means no sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia or casteism and precludes abusive behavior and doxxing, then you don't belong on this site. Second, you must use your real name in your profile and we strongly encourage using your full name as your display name. While there are plenty of good reasons for anonymity on the internet, for our purposes being able to link online reputation to real-world reputation is important.

Post Visibility

Public posts appear on the local timelines and federated timelines of sciences.social and all other mastodon instances that host your followers. Consider using Unlisted for posts you want your followers to see, but would prefer not to appear in public timelines. Using Unlisted for replies is strongly encouraged.

Posts expressing racism, homophobia and the like are not allowed with or without a content warning or with any level of visibility.

Sensitive Media

You must mark media as sensitive if it contains violence or sexual content. We also request that you mark media as sensitive if it might trigger common phobias including arachnophobia (fear of spiders) and Ophidiophobia (fear of snakes).

Getting along

Folks come here from different academic, ethnic and national cultures, so there are likely to be some mismatches in tone when we talk to one another. People might be more blunt than you are used to, or you might think someone is frustratingly obtuse when they are just trying to be polite. It's best to presume that folks here are acting in good faith. Mastodon has good tools for filtering or blocking posts you don't want to see. However, if you think someone is deliberately violating the rules or negatively affecting the community as a whole, you can report them as described below.

Reporting bad behavior

One of the great strengths of Mastodon is the ability to restrict access to bad actors. sciences.social already blocks posts from dozens of sites known to host trolls and nazis, but there'll be other bad behavior. If you use the "Report" action on someone's post the moderators can review it and take action to restrict that account. Reporting helps even for people who make their home on other servers.

Content Warnings

Content warnings are an important part of both the technical infrastructure and the culture of the Mastodon online community. They aren't just used for "triggering" content but also are often treated as a ‚Äúheadline‚Äù that allows people to choose whether they want to read the whole post. Click the CW link on your post to set one.

We strongly encourage the use of content warnings for posts that you think might be triggering or of limited interest, for example mentions of death or violence, and political debates centered on one country or locality.

While expressions of racism, casteism, homophobia, and transphobia are off-limits, we do not require content warnings for posts about those topics and their effects on people, whether academic or otherwise. Use your own judgment about using content warnings on these topics.

Site Visualization

The header image is a public domain visualization from W.E.B. Du Bois exhibit at the 1900 Paris Exhibition.
Short: Non-profit, ad-free social media for social scientists. Join thousands of social scientists here and across the fediverse.

Description:
Important!

Sign-ups currently require admin approval, unless you have an invite link from an existing user.

Feel free to put anything as the join reason, or just link to an existing social media account. (Funny messages encouraged, but not required!)

Most approvals will take a few hours, but if your account is still pending, feel free to reach out to @Crashdoom on Telegram.

"PAWBS ARE FUN THOUGH!"

-Crashdoom

This instance aimed at any and all within the furry fandom, though anyone is welcome! We're friendly towards members of the LGBTQ+ community and aiming to offer a safe space for our users.

We do not federate with fascist instances and do not tolerate fascist users.

pawb.fun is part of the pawb.social network!

Staff Team

  • @Crashdoom - Owner / Head Admin
  • @Natebluehooves - Administrator (SysAdmin)
  • @Doridian - Administrator
  • @itsOasus - Administrator
  • @herzenschein - Moderator

Moderation / Content Policies

Network Policy

We are part of pawb.social network. Any user or instance found to violate our content policies will be suspended from all instances within the pawb.social network.

Federation Policy

We are an open-first instance, however in cases where an instance had been identified as being, indifferent to, permissive of, or actively encouraging abusive conduct, that instance will be blocked from federation.

User Conduct Policy

In the hopefully unlikely event that a user breaks the rules, the offending content will be removed and the user suspended. For harassment, discrimination, or illegal activity, the user's account will be terminated.

User Generated Content

We ask that all profile content (avatar, header, display name, bio, etc.) are completely safe, without any explicit or suggestive content.

Illegal content, or content depicting hate symbolism or iconography, will be removed and result in termination of the offending user.

Report System

Please report posts that make you feel uncomfortable, break the rules, or you otherwise think should be brought to our attention. You will never be penalized for using the report system in good faith.

Donate

While donations are not expected or required, if you want to help towards our hosting, hardware, and upgrades, you can over at Ko-fi!
Short: This instance aimed at any and all within the furry fandom, though anyone is welcome! We're friendly towards members of the LGBTQ+ community and aiming to offer a safe space for our users.
topic: Pawb.Fun - Pawbs, beans, and all things fluffy

Parody accounts should tag themselves clearly in their profile description.', 'Rule #8.3 ‚Äì Bot accounts must mark themselves as a bot and must post using ‚ÄúUnlisted‚Äù, ‚ÄúFollowers only‚Äù, or ‚ÄúMentioned people only‚Äù, so we can keep the local and federated timelines clear and focused on users.', 'Rule #8.4 ‚Äì No brand or government-affiliated account may be registered on Pawb.Social services without prior written and publicly recorded approval, except furry fandom-operated brands and events covered by the exception in our full rules.', 'Rule #8.5 ‚Äì If you have been suspended from any Pawb.Social instance, you may not create another account on any of our services.', 'Rule #8.6 ‚Äì All avatars and header images must not contain any content that is prohibited by any other rule in the Code of Conduct, especially content that requires a Content Warning (CW).', 'The full Code of Conduct can be found at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jXkulJKMWEmv-cb_jaYkG2L0sTcZeHKdcqwImNkf6Ko ‚Äì Some rules and wording listed here have been summarized for brevity.']

Description:
This server is provided free of charge to all Mastodon users but aims specifically at users in Belgium.

If you really want to donate: paypal @ mastodon-belgium dot be is our official account. At this time we are not actively seeking sponsorship. Sponsoring will NOT give you any benefits or special treatment. Don't say we didn't warn you.
Short: This server is provided free of charge to all Mastodon users but aims specifically at users in Belgium.
rules:
[{'id': '5', 'text': 'Be nice to each other. No shitposting on this server.
Trolls will not be tolerated. Please act in a civilized manner.'}, {'id': '6', 'text': 'No porn, explicit or violent media, racism, sexism, fascism, homophobia, or any other form of abusive behavior, harassment or hate speech.'}, {'id': '7', 'text': 'No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies.'}, {'id': '8', 'text': 'No doxxing of users. Any form of harassment will not be tolerated.'}, {'id': '9', 'text': 'No content illegal in Belgium or, by extension, EU law.'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'No intentional spreading of fake news, false information or misleading content.
This includes attempts to impersonate Mastodon staff.'}, {'id': '11', 'text': 'No spam or advertising.'}, {'id': '12', 'text': "Politics and religion is tolerated but discouraged. Please use a Content Warning if you do post them.
Whatever your political or religious view may be is your concern but we'd appreciate it if you wouldn't use this platform to plaster it in other people's faces."}, {'id': '14', 'text': "Please don't bring discussions from other Social Media channels over to Mastodon.
If you want to discuss a topic, please do it on the originating side."}, {'id': '16', 'text': "If you're a commercial or government entity or you represent one, please consider hosting your own Mastodon instance.
This instance is set up and paid for by volunteers in order to give users access to the Fediverse.
It's not intended to be used as a commercial or governmental platform."}, {'id': '18', 'text': 'This is a private Mastodon instance, access to this server is a privilege and not a right.
The right to access and/or use this server may be revoked at any given time.
'}, {'id': '19', 'text': "Interpretation of these rules is up to the server's admin discretion and is not open for discussion.
They may change without prior notice."}]

Description:
Read this first

We're building a community around ethical, factual journalism and information literacy. This server is invite-only, but anyone who agrees to the rules can apply for an invite. Before applying, please read the server rules and Code of Ethics.

How to apply

Apply here. Please tell us who you are, why you want to be here, and how our Code of Ethics resonates with you. It can also help to include links to other social media profiles if you have them.

federated.press is a fiscally sponsored project of Open Collective Foundation, a 501(c)(3) public charity.

Our DMCA Registration Number is DMCA-1044790. To submit a claim of copyright infringement, please send an e-mail request in compliance with the US Copyright Office standards to dmca@federated.press.

Code of Ethics

By joining this Mastodon instance, you agree to embody the four foundational principles of ethical journalism from the SPJ Code of Ethics:

  • Seek truth and report it: Ethical Journalism should be accurate and fair. Ethical journalists should be honest and courageous in gathering, reporting and interpreting information.
  • Minimize harm: Ethical journalism treats sources, subjects, colleagues and members of the public as human beings deserving of respect.
  • Act independently: The highest and primary obligation of ethical journalism is to serve the public.
  • Be accountable: Ethical journalism means taking responsibility for one's work and explaining one's decisions to the public.

Please follow the link and read the full document to learn more.

FAQ

Do I have to be a working journalist to apply?
No! This instance is open to everyone. The only requirement is that you follow the rules.
Why was my application rejected?
This community is for journalists and others interested in information ethics. We‚Äôre accepting applications that give a good reason why you want to be here. If your first application wasn‚Äôt accepted (e.g., you can‚Äôt log in), feel free to reapply.

Funding

federated.press is a member of the Open Collective Foundation, and runs on donations. As a US 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, contributions are tax-deductible.

If you are an active member here, or if you want to support our mission to provide a thoughtful and inclusive home for journalists, researchers, and their allies, please consider a one-time or monthly donation (monthly is strongly preferred‚Äîit really helps with cashflow planning!).

Your organization can also become an official sponsor for $30/month. Sponsors get a logo and link on the federated.press/about page (that's this page).

Our current costs consist of:

  • Dedicated server ‚Äî $149/mo
  • Amazon SES (for email sending) ‚Äî $0/mo (free tier)
  • Domain name renewal ‚Äî $60/year
  • Liability coverage (provided through Open Collective) ‚Äî $425/year

Monthly funding goal: $47.85 of $200/mo üü©üü©‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è

Service status

See our status page for our current service status and uptime.

federated.press is a member of the Mastodon Server Covenant.
Short: A Mastodon server for journalists‚Äîby profession or temperament. Please click "Learn more" and read our rules and Code of Ethics before applying.

Description:
About CR8R

The underlying objective of the CR8R community is to be a friendly, respectful and inclusive place for all types of creators, those who support creative freedoms and those who like to appreciate and consume those creations one way or another.

You are absolutely free to come join the instance and embark on journey into the fediverse.

We do not limit registration based on language or location, please keep in mind that this instance is hosted in the UK so your experience may vary.

For our status page: status.cr8r.gg

For information, documentation & blog: cr8r.io

As a general-purpose instance (albeit with a creator theme), we do not have heavy moderation in terms of what topics people are allowed to post about, however all users are expected to follow our rules at all times, and generally be nice and friendly on the federation.

Please report all content you see which might violate our rules for evaluation. If you are on a remote server, please forward any reports of our users to our server for our moderators to take action, we pledge that remote reports will remain confidential within our moderation team and will not be used for any form of retribution against the reporter.

Mastodon Server Covenant

While this instance is relatively new, we do intend to keep it running long-term and it follow the Server Covenant as outlined at joinmastodon.org/covenant.

  • We agree to active moderation against (by not limited to): racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia

  • We agree to daily backups to ensure your data is safe

  • We have backup administrators ready to operate this server in emergencies or unexpected absence

  • In the unlikely event this instance shuts down, we agree to give our users a 3 month period to migrate to another instance

Governance

While the day to day operations are the responsibility of the Moderation Team, the instance is governed by those who use and support it.

As the instance grows, requests/suggestions etc can be submitted to help shape our future within our own little community as well as the wider fediverse.

You can DM @assist@cr8r.gg, or email assist@cr8r.gg

Moderation Team

  • Actively recruiting, send us a DM or email

Support The Instance

If you'd like to donate towards the instance, you can contribute by using our ko-fi or Liberapay pages.

All funds raised will solely be used to help cover the running & upgrade costs.

The instance nor its data will never be up for sale/sold.
Short: A community for all types of creators, those who consume the creations & everyone else (except for automated/bot accounts, they are highly discouraged).

Description:
üêò New York Metropolitan Mastodon! üóΩ

Welcome, neighbors!

You‚Äôve reached masto.nyc, a Mastodon instance based in New York City that‚Äôs open to everyone residing or working in the greater NYC area!

This server is run as a public service by Five Borough Fedi Project, a New York-based nonprofit corporation.

Membership policy

Anyone who lives or works in the New York Metropolitan Area is welcome to create an account on masto.nyc.

If you don‚Äôt live or work in the area, you‚Äôre still welcome to explore the site, but please don‚Äôt make an account here. This rule is enforced against blatant offenders who don‚Äôt reside in what Wikipedia considers the New York Metropolitan Area.

Links and resources

Site status page

Our main status page is at status.masto.nyc.

Moderators wanted! üë©üèΩ‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüë®üèø‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüë©üèª‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüßë‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è

Want to be a masto.nyc mod? Apply here!

Art credit

All of our server artwork is by Marykate Carney.

Infrastructure source code

Our infrastructure source is on GitHub. Feel free to open an issue with any feature requests or questions!

Moderation policies

All of our moderation is driven by our server rules, listed later on this page. If you haven't read them already, please do so!

Report rule-breaking behavior

We rely on our users to report content that conflicts with our server's rules. If you spot a post that breaks the rules of this server, please report it! This is true for both local and federated content.

Rules enforcement for local users

If we receive valid complaints about a masto.nyc user making rule-breaking posts, then we respond according to the following general pattern:

  1. The first infraction results in a warning.
  2. Subsequent infractions result in temporary suspension.
  3. Repeated infractions might result in permanent suspension.

We reserve the right to skip directly to suspension for egregious infractions, at the moderators' discretion.

Blocklists and defederation

We subscribe to the oliphant.social Tier 0 blocklist.

At the moderators' discretion, we might from time to time block additional servers as the situation warrants. We use our own server's rules as a guide for blocking servers. For example, if we receive reports about a server whose users post a lot of targeted spam with no obvious moderation, then we might block that server.

If you want to unblock a server, then please open an issue on our GitHub.

Shutdown policy

In adherence to the Mastodon server covenant, we post public notice three months prior to any server move or shutdown events.

Our server roadmap

This is still a really small instance, so expect some things to change as we grow.

Our current priority is to make this place a welcome home for its users. This means, in order of priority, we will be pursuing the following:

  1. Reliability and uptime
  2. Accessibility
  3. Usability

We want to make this server into a place that our neighbors want to join, with a focus on relevant content.

And last but not least, please let us know what you want out of this server!
Short: Regional New York City üêò üóΩ instance! A place to engage with your local neighbors and friends

Description:
Welcome!

This is wetdry.world, a community website running on a custom branch of Mastodon (we call it Chuckya!) focused on gaming, tech, humor, and generally whatever you may be interested in. We are connected to the wider "fedisphere", a large network of thousands of interconnected social websites, which means that a single account here on wetdry.world lets you interact and chat with millions of people from across the entire web!

We host some other stuff here as well:

  • XMPP chat (provided for active members, just ask for an account!)
  • A port of the Akkoma frontend
  • A Tor hidden service
  • More soon...

We also run a sister website with a shared community, lethallava.land, which runs on the Sharkey software instead.

Mobile apps

Mobile apps are available! Any app that works with Mastodon should work, however we recommend these apps in particular because they support the custom features we have:

  • iOS: Feditext (currently in beta, message the linked account to join their TestFlight program!)
  • Android: Moshidon (fork of the official Mastodon Android app, adds many useful/missing features)

Credits

We use resources/custom emoji from the following sources:

  • Blobfox (Apache 2.0), drgn, Neocat, and Neofox (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) by Volpeon
  • Blobcats by various people, licensed under Apache 2.0
  • Mastodon Modern by Freeplay, licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0
  • so happy smiling cat by puamelia, licensed under CC BY-SA 2.0
  • Neorat by Onemuri
  • Robomoji, a modified subset of Mutant Standard emoji which is licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

Donate

We don't run any ads, sell data, or charge for usage; the funding to keep this site running comes from optional monthly donations. If you enjoy this place, please consider saying thanks by leaving a tip on Patreon or Ko-fi!

Wet-Dry World, also known as Wet-Dry Land, is the eleventh course in Super Mario 64 and Super Mario 64 DS, and it takes place within flooded ruins, separated into an undeveloped uptown that the player starts in and an underground downtown further into the level. The entrance to the course is the large painting with the Skeeter on it on the Mushroom Castle's second floor. Unique to this course is the ability to raise or lower the water level based on where the painting is entered; the lower the painting is entered, the lower the water level, and the higher the painting is entered, the higher the water level. - Super Mario Wiki
Short: We are a community based around gaming, tech, entertainment, and more! Come join the Scuttlebug jamboree! (Signups currently undergoing manual review.)

Description:
This instance is open to researchers and practitioners in computer systems, including students, faculty, and industry professionals. Systems is broadly defined here -- it includes operating systems, distributed systems, networking, databases, architecture, and more. People in adjacent fields are welcome as well.

Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and inclusion make our community strong. We encourage participation from the most varied and diverse backgrounds possible and want to be very clear about where we stand.
  • Our goal is to maintain a safe, helpful and friendly community for everyone, regardless of experience, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, or other defining characteristic.
  • Rules are detailed above. If you are the subject of, or witness to any violations of this Code of Conduct, please contact the administrators. If violations occur, administrators will take any action they deem appropriate for the infraction, up to and including expulsion.

This server is administered by Dan Ports.
Short: Discussion of computer systems research & practice -- OSes, distributed systems, networks, databases, architecture, etc -- for researchers, academics, & professionals.

Description:
Mastodon for respectful technologists. Geeks and nerds of every type and stripe.

Why choose vmst.io as your Mastodon server?

  • We run the latest available Mastodon code, usually before anyone else, and regularly contribute fixes back to the Mastodon project.
  • We're built to be highly performant and highly available, taking ownership of issues when we're not. We also publish our realtime system status, and strive for better than 99.9% observed availability.
  • We are well moderated, with multiple volunteer staffers around the world monitoring for user reports, with clear rules against hate speech and harassment. We proactively defederate from known bad actors to protect our users.
  • We believe in giving you options in how you use Mastodon and experience the Fediverse. We integrate popular third-party themes like Elephant (Bird UI) and Tangerine directly into your preference options, as well as hosting our own copies of Elk and Phanpy!
  • We are 100% member funded! We have no corporate sponsors or venture capitalist backers. Our shareholders are our staff and users. While access to your account does not require a paid subscription, for those that can afford it we have Ko-Fi and Patreon as ways to help on a monthly basis.
  • We have an A+ rating from Mozilla Observatory and Qualys SSL Labs, but most importantly we don't leverage any third party cookies, use trackers or run ads on our service, as verified by The Markup's Blacklight.
  • We are currently listed on the official joinmastodon.org Server Directory under Technology, and as such we are a party to the Mastodon Server Covenant which outlines the fundamental expectations for server administration.

When you apply for an account on vmst.io, we require you to verify you're a legitimate human being by verifying your email and completing an hCaptcha. Our staff may also manually flag your account for additional verification if required. For more information please refer to our New Accounts documentation.

Frequently asked questions

  • Can my company sign up?
  • Where are you hosted?
  • Can the admins read my private messages?
  • Do you use AI or feed data to LLMs?
  • Do you block Threads?

For more, please visit docs.vmst.io
Short: vmst¬∑io is Mastodon for respectful technologists. Geeks and nerds of every type and stripe. Highly available, well federated, and community minded.

Description:
WeHaveCookies.social

This server is for everyone who is up for a relaxed and open community. Everything and everyone is welcome here: humor, technology, politics, cats, dogs, nerds, entertainment, incoherent thoughts, you name it.

We are doing our best to always run the latest release of mastodon (sometimes a release flies by without us noticing, in this case, just post a friendly reminder to @admin üòä).

We have enabled full text search on your own statuses, mentions, favourites, and bookmarks.

Note our privacy policy and terms of use.

Every account posting advertisements as soon as possible will be banned instantly.

We are committed to the "Mastodon Server Covenant", which means:

  • Racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia have no place with us
  • We make daily backups of all data
  • There is a second person who can take care of the server in case of emergency
  • We commit to inform all users at least 3 months in advance in case the server shuts down.

Blocklist

The blocklist of the server was based off the one at chaos.social and was last updated on 11/13/2022. Explanations:

  • "Free speech zone": a server where it is okay to share e.g. Nazi propaganda, on the grounds that open discourse is more important than people's sensitivities or the laws of e.g. Germany or France.
  • "lolicon": sexualized depiction of children

Server Hardware

Our hardware is located in German data centers and operated by Hetzner (German) and OVH(French).

Hetzner hosts our compute:

  • 4 CPU vCore
  • 16 GB RAM
  • 150 GB SSD
  • 20TB of traffic included

OVH hosts our storage: unlimited SWIFT object storage with 'pay as you go' model.

The costs are at the moment ~‚Ç¨30. You can check the monthly updates at @BentiGorlich#cookiecosts

Donate

  • LiberaPay
  • PayPal

Other services hosted by me

  • /MBin thebrainbin.org
  • /MBin German gehirneimer.de

(/MBin is a reddit-esque plattform MBin github)
Short:
Join us, we have cookies!
Everything and everyone is welcome here: humor, technology, politics, cats, dogs, nerds, entertainment, incoherent thoughts, you name it.

Description:
There has been some concern expressed from members of the disability community on Twitter over people that have been blocked by some of the people running disabled.social. People who have been blocked over on Twitter either individually or as part of a block chain, are welcome here. The admins and moderators will not be personally blocking anyone on disabled.social unless there are threats of violence or overt defamatory claims made (which is a rules violation, and your account will be handled accordingly). There are several of us running this instance, so if there is an issue you need to raise, hopefully there is someone here that you are comfortable speaking with.

ALL are welcome here.

Sign Ups

When signing up, please indicate both why you want to join disabled.social and more importantly, how you plan to use the instance.

We have many organizations, charities, non-profits, adaptive tech developers, attorneys, medical providers with businesses, etc. interested in joining the instance, and we want to understand how you plan on using our space which is intended as a support space for disabled people.

We do not allow marketing to disabled people or mining them for your own commercial gains under any circumstances.

Failure to answer how you plan to use the instance will result in rejection of your application.

Rules

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviors that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the discretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report offensive behavior to the contact email address provided. Reports will be kept confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour or content promoting/advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterized by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete): Ethnicity or race; Gender identity or expression; Sexual identity or expression; Physical characteristics or age; Disability or illness; Nationality, residency, citizen status; Wealth or education; Religious affiliation, agnosticism, or atheism; Neurodivergence
  • We do not tolerate threatening behavior, stalking, or doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering, or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism, or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Scientific discussion is critical to our community. However, conspiracy theories related to anti-vaxx and COVID19 without any scientific basis will not be tolerated.

Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate temporary or permanent account suspension.

Content that is illegal in the United States will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

General Best Practices

The list below is a collection of behaviors that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("‚Ä¶@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. When using sarcasm, please indicate with /s.
  • Please be mindful of your language, and avoid the use of ableist and saneist language. We recognize that sometimes it can be hard to find another word to clearly communicate what you are trying to say. We have created a resource to help you find alternative language while still being able to convey your point.
  • Please use captions in uploaded videos.
  • There are times when users just want to vent about their situation. Unless requested explicitly, please do not drop unsolicited advice. In some cases, it might be ok to ask OP directly if they want advice.

Best Practices to Assist Screen Readers

Some of our users make use of screen readers. There are a few things that make for a smoother experience:

  • Reminder to alt-text your images. If you are low on spoons, please use #AltTextHelp and someone from the community should be able to help and provide it.
  • Avoid using multiple emojis in a row. Ex: putting 3 smiley faces in a row, or 60 red flags.
  • If you want to use hashtags throughout a toot, please do so sparingly. Best to put the majority of them at the end of the toot.
  • Use CamelCase for the hashtags. Ex: #DisabledSocial
  • Please use as few emoji in usernames or screen names as possible (preferably none)
  • Please don't scatter emojis between words in an alternating pattern. Ex: word followed by clapping hands emoji, repeated indefinitely. Use them sparingly.
  • When sharing a link, please provide a brief description of where the link directs to.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of chaos.social. Thank you!)

Mutual Aid

The posting and sharing of mutual aid and fundraisers are welcome here on disabled.social because they are critical for the survival of some of our members. Disability payments are often woefully inadequate to meet the much higher cost of living as a chronically ill and/or disabled person. These types of things are sometimes the only way that someone can afford rent, can afford to move out of a terrible housing situation, to be able to afford a mobility aid, etc. Please do not report these posts as spam. If they bother you, you can filter them out of your feed. And regarding the hashtags used: that is up to the discretion of the member who is posting. They know which hashtags are best for their specific situation.

Attribution

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Admin/Mod Commitment to Non-Commercialization Statement

We all would like to reiterate that regardless of what any of us do for work, research, or advocacy, we will not be individually trying to commercialize the disabled.social instance.

Instance Blog

Our instance has a blog! You can check it out here.

Donations

If you wish to donate to help offset the costs of keeping the servers running, we have a Patreon setup at https://www.patreon.com/disabledsocial. Any donations are appreciated, however if you are in any way financially struggling but would like to contribute, please contact us for other ideas on how you can help!
Short: A place for people who are chronically ill, mentally ill, disabled, and friends/families/allies to come together, meet, share knowledge and random banter, and just about anything else.

Description:
About Blorbo.Social

Blorbo.Social is a community of fandom nerds.

We talk about our favourite blorbos from our shows, create fanart, fanfic, fanvids and other transformative works, and share our weird unique selves.

We follow the Three Laws of Fandom:

  • Don‚Äôt Like; Don‚Äôt Read (DL;DR)
  • Your Kink Is Not My Kink (YKINMK)
  • Ship And Let Ship (SALS).

We are anti-racist, anti-fascist, queer-friendly, and kink-friendly.

Getting started

A quick intro to Blorbo.Social and Mastodon

There are many other guides available online to help you get familiar with Mastodon and the Fediverse. Here are a few good ones:

  • Create an account on fandom masto: a super-simple guide
  • Fediverse.info
  • The Compassionate User‚Äôs Guide to Mastodon
  • Fedi.Tips
  • An increasingly less-brief guide to Mastodon

For more fandom resources, including a list of other fandom-focused Mastodon instances, go to @bloodwrites‚Äòs Links page.

Explaining the rules

All members must agree to follow our server rules before they can create an account on Blorbo.Social. This section supplements and explains the official server rules.

If you are not sure whether something is allowable under the rules, check the explanations in this section, or ask @admin.

If you break the rules, your account may be limited or suspended, either temporarily or permanently.

Admins reserve the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

This does not mean you will be limited or suspended over nothing! However, we can‚Äôt foresee everything, and there are sometimes edge cases, deliberate skirting around the rules, or other harmful behaviour that we haven‚Äôt codified in the rules.

By joining this server, you assert that you are at least 18 years old

This is an adults-only community. Members must be 18 or older.

Use content wrappers (CW) when posting adult content

We encourage you to share adult, explicit, or not safe for work (NSFW) fanart, fic and other fannish content here.

You must use a content wrapper (CW) or sensitive media checkbox for posts depicting nudity, lewd, sexual, or violent content.

When a media attachment is NSFW, but the text is not, you can select the ‚ÄòMark media as sensitive‚Äô checkbox without also using a CW, if you want.

When the text itself is NSFW, use a suitable CW. (Any attachment under a CW is automatically marked as sensitive.)

Don‚Äôt put NSFW content in avatars or headers.

No lolicon, shotacon, cub, or any similar images

If you think it‚Äôs possible that someone could look at a smutty image and think it depicts an underage person or character, don‚Äôt post it here.

Text descriptions of sexual activity by post-pubescent underage characters are allowed, and must be behind a suitable CW.

We use the definition of underage from Archive of Our Own: ‚ÄúUnderage refers to descriptions or depictions of sexual activity by characters under the age of eighteen (18). In general, we rely on authors to use their judgement about the line between reference and description or depiction. Sexual activity does not include dating activity such as kissing, but again, we rely on authors to use their judgment about what is generally understood to be sexual activity. An author may always specify the age of the characters.‚Äù

Do not repost fanworks uncredited, or when the creator has requested no reposts

We want Blorbo.Social to be a respectful, welcoming space for the people who create the fanworks we all enjoy.

Don't take credit for someone else's fanwork, or imply that it's your own work by posting it without crediting the source. If you post a fanwork without credit, many people will assume that you are the creator. That‚Äôs unfair to the actual creator.

Instead of reposting fanworks, we recommend that you link to the creator‚Äôs work or boost it. That way, the creator gets to see people enjoying their work, and fans can find more of the creator‚Äôs work.

Don‚Äôt ever repost fanworks when the creator has specifically asked people not to do that.

It's usually fine to post uncredited content from official source material, such as screencaps, official art or photos, panels for manga, manhua, etc. Include credits if you can, but don‚Äôt stress if you can‚Äôt. Most of your fellow fans aren't going to assume that you're the creator of the official source material.

No hate speech, harassment, threats, or incitement of violence

We don‚Äôt allow hate speech of any kind including, but not limited to, racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, other types of queerphobia, ableism, discrimination based on religion or nationality, body shaming, slut-shaming, or kink-shaming.

We don‚Äôt tolerate micro-aggressions either.

Don‚Äôt harass people on this or any other instance in the Fediverse. Don‚Äôt insult people, pick fights, or abuse them, in public or in private.

Harassment includes:

  • Attacking or harassing people based on what their opinions or taste in ships or fictional content seems to be.
  • Inciting dogpiles based on what someone's opinions or taste in ships or fictional content seems to be.
  • Posting or reposting call-out posts focused on what someone's opinions or taste in ships or fictional content seems to be.
  • Sending someone porn or other sensitive content (written or illustrated) in bad faith with the intent of upsetting them or making them uncomfortable. This includes targeting a known or suspected trigger or squick, but not good-faith social faux pas situations where you genuinely thought the recipient might be interested.

If someone asks you to stop contacting them, respect their request and don‚Äôt contact them any more.

Don‚Äôt threaten anyone with violence or promote any violent ideologies.

No illegal content

This includes content that is illegal in your country of origin, and additionally: the United Kingdom, Germany and Australia.

The additional countries listed are due to our host's Terms of Service (ToS) and the location of some of our moderation staff.

Everything you post here must be legal to post. This includes any Direct post with a privacy setting of ‚Äòmentioned people only‚Äô.

Don‚Äôt spread disinformation

We won‚Äôt tolerate people wilfully spreading disinformation. No conspiracy nuts, anti-vaxxers, or anyone who describes other people as 'sheeple' who need to 'open their eyes'.

COVID is real, vaccinations work, your government almost certainly isn‚Äôt injecting you with nanobots, and the earth isn‚Äôt flat.

No spam, scams, corporate advertising, or shilling crypto or NFTs

Don‚Äôt post anything that treats other people as resources to be exploited for profit.

However, if you are an independent creator or a small business, you are welcome to promote your own work or services.

Do you have a book to sell, an Etsy store, or a fan event to promote? Are you an artist open for commissions? Tell us about it!

There is a tradition of mutual aid on parts of the fediverse. You can post occasional mutual aid requests on behalf of yourself or others.

We don‚Äôt allow accounts that only post mutual aid requests or promote things for sale.

Community guidelines

Our community guidelines are not rules, but instead describe our community norms and recommendations. You don‚Äôt have to remember or follow all of them.

Have fun

Share your fandom passions, interests, and loves. Tell us about your blorbos. Your love for your blorbos is why Blorbo.Social exists.

Show us your weird unique self. We're all here because we love our blorbos, but each of us is a complex person with interests other than fandom. You can and should post about non-fandom stuff too.

Be silly, or serious, or both simultaneously.

Tell us what you‚Äôre grateful for, what you‚Äôre excited about, what worries you, how you get inspired, what keeps you going, what discourages you.

Ask questions. Answer other people‚Äôs questions. Cheer others on. If you‚Äôre interested in what others are saying or doing, tell them! Human connections make this place special.

Engage with others and make friends, or sit quietly and observe. It‚Äôs all good.

Don‚Äôt attack other people‚Äôs fun

Antis are not welcome at Blorbo.Social. If you think that it‚Äôs sick and wrong to imagine your favourite fictional characters or celebrities in sexy situations, this is not the place for you.

If you adore Blorbo, but hate the idea of Blorbo in a relationship with OtherBlorbo, put your rants about the BlorbOther pairing behind a suitable CW, and don‚Äôt tag it #BlorbOther. People looking at the #BlorbOther tag aren‚Äôt (usually) looking for BlorbOther hate.

Be cool about Who Tops and Who Bottoms. It‚Äôs okay to have your own preferences, as long as you respect that other people can have preferences different to yours.

Be kind

Arguments and disagreements happen. Assume that most people are engaging in good faith, and treat them with kindness and respect even when you disagree with them.

Don‚Äôt take offence too quickly when other people disagree with you, or when they have opinions that you don‚Äôt like.

Everyone has grumpy days. It‚Äôs okay to be grumpy sometimes, as long as ‚ÄúGrumpy Arsehole‚Äù isn‚Äôt your entire personality.

It‚Äôs not okay to consistently bitch and moan, make fun of people, belittle others, or insult them.

Tag and wrap your posts

Whenever you post something that someone might have an intense reaction to, it‚Äôs considerate to use a CW.

We require CWs (or sensitive media tags) for nudity, lewd, sexual, or violent content. We recommend that you use CWs for spoilers and sensitive content that other people might not want to see right now. Noelle‚Äôs guide has some good examples of when to use CWs.

Be specific in your tags and CWs so that people have a good idea of what to expect when they click.

If you‚Äôre describing something that contains NSFW content, but the post itself doesn‚Äôt contain the NSFW content, you don‚Äôt need to use a CW. For example, you can post a link to an explicit fic or fanart, and describe what people will find there, without having any explicit content in the post itself. We recommend that you still use the NSFW hashtag on posts like these, so that people can filter out these posts if they want.

We have some more guidelines and advice about tagging and wrapping your posts.

Add alt text to images

When you post images, add an alt text description to each image, if you can. This helps people with visual impairments, and has other benefits too. Here are some guidelines for writing good alt text.

If you can‚Äôt write the alt text yourself, you can tag @imagecaptionspls@a.gup.pe in your post. This alerts a group of volunteers who may write a description for your image.

Control what you see

Curate your own experience. Follow people whose posts you like. Search for and follow hashtags for your favourite topics.

Mastodon has many features that enable you to control what you see. Filter, unfollow, mute and block when necessary.

Sometimes people suck. They might deliberately try to rile you up, act in bad faith, lie or misrepresent facts, or attempt to manipulate you or others. When this happens, it can be hard to step back, but that‚Äôs what we recommend.

If the person‚Äôs posts are breaking our rules, you can report the posts in question. A moderator will investigate and deal with it.

If you don‚Äôt like someone, but they aren‚Äôt actually breaking our rules, don‚Äôt file a report against them. Just mute or block the person instead.

Don‚Äôt police others‚Äô use of CWs, alt text, or tags

Whilst we have some guidelines around when to use CWs, alt text, and tags, we only have one rule about them: Use CWs for adult or NSFW content.

You can politely ask other people to use specific CWs, alt text, or tags that you prefer, as long as you don‚Äôt state your preferences as absolute rules or requirements.

This is especially important when marginalised people speak about their experiences of marginalisation. For example, if you are not BIPOC, don‚Äôt tell BIPOC to hide their experiences of racism behind CWs.

While we strongly recommend that you add alt text to images, it‚Äôs not always possible. There are people with disabilities that make it difficult for them to write alt text descriptions themselves. Sometimes accessibility needs are conflicting, and that‚Äôs okay.

If other people choose to use CWs, alt text and tags differently to how you‚Äôd prefer, that‚Äôs up to them. You can always filter, unfollow or block people who post in ways that you don‚Äôt like.

Find another community if this one doesn‚Äôt suit you

This community can't be all things to all people for all time, and we don't want it to be.

If at any point you find that Blorbo.Social isn't a happy place for you, it‚Äôs okay to take a break or to leave. Maybe you're just not that interested in fandom any more, or you're not feeling the blorbo vibe.

No hard feelings! You can move to another instance that suits you better, or leave the Fediverse entirely.

Moderation

Blorbo.Social has a team of volunteer admins and moderators. They manage our community, set our server rules, investigate reports, and take action when people break our rules.

If you see someone breaking the rules

If you believe that someone is posting content that violates our rules, report the post in question. Select the three dots (...) on the post, then Report. Include your reason for reporting.

We take all reports seriously. A mod will investigate and decide what to do.

We cannot comment on the outcome of any particular investigation.

If the person seems to be acting in good faith, it‚Äôs okay to drop a friendly reminder about the rules, but this isn‚Äôt required or expected.

If someone is hostile to you, we recommend that you report their posts, then ignore and block them. If you feel a need to respond and defend yourself, try not to escalate. Remember that responding often inspires harassers to continue their harassment.

Consequences for Blorbo.Social members

If you break a rule, a mod will contact you to explain how you broke the rule and what the consequences are.

Consequences can include:

  • A gentle reminder
  • A warning
  • Temporarily limiting your account
  • Temporarily suspending your account
  • Permanently suspending your account.

When deciding on consequences, we consider:

  • The importance of the rule
  • How hard you broke it
  • How others are affected
  • Whether this is the first time or it's part of a pattern
  • How you respond to being called on it.

Consequences for people on other instances

If the poster's account is on a different instance, we may:

  • Do nothing
  • Reject the person‚Äôs media (images, etc) so that they don‚Äôt display on our instance
  • Silence the person, so their posts are no longer visible on our federated timeline and can‚Äôt be boosted here (people here can still opt in to follow them)
  • Suspend the person‚Äôs account from our instance, so it‚Äôs no longer possible to follow or interact with them from here.

In addition, if we find that the person‚Äôs instance accepts behaviour that breaks Blorbo.Social‚Äôs rules, we may decide to reject media, silence or suspend the entire instance.

Federation

Our moderated servers list is visible to logged-in members only. We have chosen not to publish our reasons for moderating specific servers.

Our general guidelines on federation are:

  • No limits: Default. Also applies if we don‚Äôt especially like an instance, but they're not actually breaking any of our rules.
  • Reject media only: If they allow Loli/Shota or un-CWed NSFW media but otherwise are cool, e.g. a lot of porn & kinky instances. However, if they also regularly post un-CWed NSFW text, we‚Äôll silence instead.
  • Silence: If they don‚Äôt follow some of our rules, but also don't tolerate illegal or harmful behaviour, hate speech, or deliberate trolling. If an instance is struggling to keep up with moderation, we may silence temporarily to give them a chance to fix it.
  • Suspend: If they tolerate or encourage harmful activity, harassment, hate speech (TERFs & racists etc), fascists, CSAM, shitty bots, deliberate trolling.

Technical

Blorbo.social is a Mastodon instance hosted on toot.io as part of their Managed Mastodon Hosting service.

Our Mastodon server configuration includes:

  • A 500-character limit per post
  • Default file attachment limits as detailed in Mastodon documentation.

Posts on Blorbo.Social, including Direct posts, are not secure or encrypted. Admins can read your posts, although we will not normally do so unless needed for investigating claims of abuse or harassment.

Contributions

Blorbo.Social is a volunteer-run and community-funded project.

If you‚Äôre interested in joining the volunteer crew, contact @admin.

We plan to keep this community free for members. If you have spare funds to throw at hosting expenses, here‚Äôs our Open Collective (but there‚Äôs no expectation or requirement).

Financial contributions make no difference to our members' rights or responsibilities.

Content ownership

You retain the rights to any original content that you post on Blorbo.Social.

You grant us the right to publish and share the content in accordance with the post privacy options that you select.

Credits

We use custom emojis on this instance, including some by:

  • @ikol (Our Flag Means Death and Marvel, licensed under CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0)
  • @Raene (some Modao Zushi and Chen Qing Ling (Untamed)(the CQL sect emojis are colourized versions of images from suibianjiejie), some Final Fantasy & oujo)
  • Blob Emoji community (most blob, blobcat and blobhaj)
  • Mingilicious (skzoo)

Our Privacy Policy is based on the terms initially published by eupolicy.social and made more accessible by the Mastodon Privacy Policy Generator in its version v1.1 as of 22 November 2022.

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Description:
About

A Mastodon server for the Genomic Science Community.


Support

This instance is administered and hosting paid for by James Ferguson ( @Psy_Fer_@genomic.social )

As the instance grows, so do the server hosting fees to maintain a smooth user experience.

You can donate to support these costs here:



liberapay*:





PayPal: (removed because Paypal is honestly horrible)


*liberapay take 0% of the money donated. They are a non-for-profit organisation and seemed to be the best fit for donations, with most foreign currencies available using stripe.


Data Scaping

Data scraping and/or the use of instance and/or user data in machine learning models is not allowed.
Short: A Mastodon server for the Genomic Science Community.
